Product_Name: ZEBRONICS Zeb-Bro in Ear Wired Earphones with Mic, 3.5mm Audio Jack, 10mm Drivers, Phone/Tablet Compatible(Blue) (Green)
Review_Title: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Amazing Earphones – Great Sound and Unbeatable Value
Review_Text:
The ZEBRONICS Zeb-Bro in-ear wired earphones are a fantastic find! 🎧 For such an affordable price, the sound quality is truly impressive. The 10mm drivers deliver clear audio with balanced bass, making music, podcasts, and calls a pleasure. Whether I’m listening to soft melodies or bass-heavy tracks, the sound is crisp and immersive. 🎵

The in-built mic is a great addition, ensuring clear communication during calls without any issues. I’ve used these earphones for both meetings and casual conversations, and the performance is flawless.

The 3.5mm audio jack offers wide compatibility, and it works perfectly with my phone, laptop, and tablet. Plus, the comfort of the earbuds is worth mentioning – they fit snugly without causing any discomfort, even during extended use.

What I love the most is how lightweight and durable these earphones are. The cable is of decent length and doesn't tangle easily, which is a huge bonus. For such a budget-friendly price, ZEBRONICS has nailed it with both quality and performance!

If you’re looking for reliable, everyday earphones that offer great sound at an affordable price, the Zeb-Bro is an excellent choice.

Five stars – Highly recommended! 🌟

Product_Name: ZEBRONICS Zeb-Bro in Ear Wired Earphones with Mic, 3.5mm Audio Jack, 10mm Drivers, Phone/Tablet Compatible(Blue) (Green)
Review_Title: ZEBRONICS Zeb-Bro Wired Earphones: Decent Sound but Lacks Durability
Review_Text:
I recently purchased the ZEBRONICS Zeb-Bro Wired Earphones, and while they offer decent sound quality and a comfortable fit, there are some concerns regarding their durability.

Let's start with the positives. The earphones provide a snug fit, ensuring comfort even during long listening sessions. The 10mm drivers deliver satisfactory sound performance, allowing you to enjoy your favorite music and audio with clarity. The passive noise cancellation feature is an added bonus, as it helps immerse you in your audio experience by reducing external noise distractions.

Connecting the earphones to your device is a straightforward process. Simply plug in the 3.5mm audio jack, and within a few seconds, the earphones sync with your phone or tablet, ready to deliver audio.

On the downside, the build quality of the earphone cable raises concerns. Some users have reported that the wires are not as sturdy as expected, making them susceptible to damage and tangling. This weakness in the wire construction may impact the longevity of the earphones, requiring extra care and attention during use and storage.

The ZEBRONICS Zeb-Bro Wired Earphones come in a sleek design and are available in multiple color options, including Black, Blue, Green, Red, and White, allowing you to choose the one that suits your style.

In terms of technical specifications, the earphones have an impedance of 16 Ω and a frequency response range of 20Hz-20kHz. The 1.2-meter cable length provides adequate flexibility for comfortable usage.

It's important to note that these earphones come with a 6-month warranty, which provides some assurance in case of any manufacturing defects or malfunctions within the specified period.

In conclusion, the ZEBRONICS Zeb-Bro Wired Earphones offer decent sound quality and a comfortable fit, making them suitable for everyday use. However, the durability concerns surrounding the wire strength are worth considering. If you prioritize longevity and robustness in your earphone choice, you may want to explore other options. Nevertheless, if you handle them with care, these earphones can provide an enjoyable audio experience at an affordable price point.

Product_Name: Sony WH-CH720N Noise Cancellation Wireless Bluetooth Over Ear Headphones with Mic, Up to 50Hrs Battery- Black
Review_Text: I got this at 7999 with debit card cash back. I am using this since last 2 and a half weeks.My review so far is:Sound : 5/5Build quality: 4/5Mic quality: 3/5Battery: 5/5Volume control: 5/5ANC: 4/5I will rate this overall 4.5/5I am not much bothered about mic quality because that’s not my primary use. I got this only for music and it’s serving up to the mark.Duel device connection works well.Battery life with ANC will declines little bit fast, although I am using it mostly without ANC.ANC: It works just fine, it’s a budget ANC headphones so I don’t expect much. Those who have used proper ANC headphones might find this one less efficient. For me it works fine.Music: Well what can I say? I had used sony a lot in the past, but was pre bluetooth era. This was really a great experience for me. EQ works really well and you can actually spot a difference when you adjust the difference. Sound is crisp and clear. You can really hear all the instruments clearly. Vocals are crispy too, not too much not less they have this little sweet spot! Bass is really great too, although you have to boost it a little bit, but basic settings may also work for you.App: So far I found app working well, you can connect and disconnect devices within app as well. EQ settings work well too, you can basically create your own custom EQ ( recommended for audiophiles). App looks little cluttered I guess they will change it in future.Volume: It is crazy loud given the size of drivers they have. I have only used it at 50% volume most of the time when I am at home, hardly went to 70% in public without any ANC. But I recommend you to use ANC if you are surrounded by too much noise in public.Size and Fit :These are over the ear, so they fit perfectly fine over your ears. I was actually surprised how good they fit over my ears. Cushions are very well made, have good texture and soft enough to not hurt your ears. The headphones are big enough to be recognised from a distance.Downsides:I really hoped they could have given carrying case because headphones themselves are sturdy but they still need protection while carrying.Also these are not foldable, so carrying them can be little difficult, you may have to purchase a separate carrying case.

Product_Name: Sony WH-CH720N Noise Cancellation Wireless Bluetooth Over Ear Headphones with Mic, Up to 50Hrs Battery- Black
Review_Title: Big Hype for Big Price, Not recommended
Review_Text: I bought this during the Great Indian Festival, and the price was slashed down to 7,998 from its usual price of 9,999. I also got a 10% discount on my SBI card, so the price was close to 7,190. Delighted with the deal, I ordered the black color as my favorite blue was priced 2,000 INR more. I got it delivered within two days, thanks to fast delivery by Amazon, of course, probably if you are a Prime member. After using it for the first 15 minutes, I wasn't quite impressed. I called Amazon Customer Care, but they refused to accept the return, so if you want to buy from Amazon, be sure to try it at a local Sony Shop or Mall if it's available there. So being unable to return the product, I was forced to continue with it, and here are the things I noticed:Sound quality - To date, based on all the headphones and earphones that I have used, I think it is one of the best. I haven't used top-of-the-line headphones from Sony, Bose, Apple, etc., so the sound quality, based on my audio experience was pretty good. Also, some reviews say it is close to XM5, though there is a slight discernable difference in clarity.Sony App and EQ Settings- I tried to fine-tune the music to my hearing taste, and the music sounded a bit better. The app asked for a picture of my ear to adjust the sounds according to the acoustics of my ears. I found these features a bit overhyped. While there were some changes in audio, and some features may indeed work, most of these things are hyped as stand-out features for marketing purposes to attract consumers. Also, I have tried using the headphones without these settings, and although there was some difference, it sounded good even without these fine-tunings.ANC - It cancels out some noises in the background like the buzzing fan on my ceiling, but it's unable to cancel out the sound of my family members speaking around me, the TV audio (even though it is quite far in the drawing room and I am sitting in my bedroom), so it can cancel noise upto a certain degree beyond that it is of no use. I had watched a lot of Tech Reviews of various under 10k headphones before going for this one, they all have a similar problem, ANC works only up to a certain dB of noise, though it is understandable. If you want better ANC, probably go for higher-priced headphones.Dual pairing and call quality - I use my headphones for many purposes like calling for meetings, listening to music, watching YouTube videos, movies, etc. So, a dual-pairing headphone would have been very much useful for me. While I considered this headphone, this was also one of the features that I had in mind. But the result was disappointing; dual pairing works, but the sound quality deteriorates severely. According to my research, in dual pair mode, it doesn't use the LDAC codec; rather, it uses the SBC/AAC codec, resulting in a deterioration of sound and call quality. In many cases, the person on the other side couldn't even hear clearly what I am saying. So, the call and music quality are both below average, or you may even say poor in dual pairing, which makes this feature irrelevant.Connectivity - While in dual pair mode, it also experienced connectivity issues. There were times when the headphones got disconnected, and I had to manually switch or reconnect them. Contacting Amazon's customer care regarding this issue didn't help.Battery life - Before I purchased this, I had seen tech reviews claiming it has amazing battery life. But when I used it (I use it for office work as well as for my entertainment, so I use it 8-12 hours a day), I found that the battery life is not that great. I use it without ANC most of the time as I am working from home. The battery ran for about 3-4 full days, which is 30-35 hours, much below what Sony claims.Comfort - I have heard in many YouTube tech reviews that it is comfortable, but actually I found it quite opposite. In my opinion, ANC headphones under 10k are a big waste of money, especially if you are in hot and humid regions of India. The reason is that due to ear padding and isolation, your ears will heat up within 30 minutes and sweat, so you have to remove the headphones. Also, even though its padding is soft it's quite tight on the ear, and after 30 minutes of use, it causes discomfort, and you have to remove it.  So, I can't say it's very comfortable. Unless you are working in air-conditioning most of the time in hot and humid climate, it's better to look for TWS buds. If you are looking for noise-cancellation headphones, look for passive noise cancellation headphones that comes at much cheaper price with matching sound quality; there are a few below 3,000 INR which truly sound equally well.So, to summarize - In my opinion, it is a big hype for the big bucks you spend. If you get this for more than 7,000 INR, it doesn't seem worth it unless you like the brand name. If you are keen on quality ANC headphones then raise your budget; otherwise, at this price, I don't think I am fully satisfied with what it offers.

Product_Name: Sony WH-CH720N Noise Cancellation Wireless Bluetooth Over Ear Headphones with Mic, Up to 50Hrs Battery- Black
Review_Title: Impressive Sound Quality and Decent Noise Cancellation
Review_Text: I recently purchased this headphone and I must say, it has exceeded my expectations. The sound quality is truly remarkable, delivering a rich and immersive audio experience that brings my music and podcasts to life. Whether I'm jamming to my favorite tunes or engrossed in a podcast, the clarity and depth of the sound are truly impressive.One of the standout features for me is the microphone's noise cancellation capabilities. While it may not completely eliminate all background noise, it does a commendable job of reducing ambient sounds during calls. The result is clear and crisp communication without the distractions of external noise. It's perfect for virtual meetings and online gaming sessions where effective communication is key.The design of the headphone is sleek and comfortable, making it suitable for extended wear. The over-ear cups provide a snug fit without causing discomfort, and the adjustable headband ensures a customized and secure fit. The build quality also feels robust, indicating durability for everyday use.I appreciate the user-friendly controls that allow me to adjust volume, skip tracks, and manage calls effortlessly. The Bluetooth connectivity is reliable, providing a stable connection with my devices without any noticeable lag.Overall, this headphone is a solid choice for anyone seeking a combination of excellent sound quality and decent noise cancellation. It strikes a great balance between performance and affordability, making it a valuable addition to my audio gear. Highly recommended!

Product_Name: Sony WH-CH720N Noise Cancellation Wireless Bluetooth Over Ear Headphones with Mic, Up to 50Hrs Battery- Black
Review_Title: Balanced sound output in this budget of 6190/-
Review_Text: I am using it continuously for last 6 months and gave it 5🌟 overall for the things it offers in the price of just 6k... Yes 6k is just the initiation of good quality ANC bluetooth over the ear headset, people are expecting XM or bose or Sennheiser quality in 6k or 8k,lol....if it's in 8k or 10k range i would give it 4🌟 instead. Here's my findings —Pros:-1. Sound output - 4.5/5 ... Default sound is pretty flat, but quickly gets interesting after playing with eq, dsee, anc etc. . Sound volume is pretty average but distortion in max vol. is low. It's a general purpose headset, good enough for all aspects like rock, pop, bass,instrumental, classical, rap etc. . Seperation is nice, different tones have distinct identities. But for specific needs like for bass or vocal, strech your budget a bit more. I don't think you can get better than this balance of sound output in this budget.2. ANC - 4/5 actually it's pretty decent, but could be a little better. Afterall it's an entry level ANC.3. Built - 4.5/5 simplistic plastic built, no fancy cosmetics, but solid and mature, very much flexible, not gonna break anytime, good elasticity for sticking with head. Though it's plastic built but has stainless steel housing around stretchable arms which is very nice to have for long term usage. Most headsets break from this sections.4. Battery- 5/5 fabulous battery life even with anc on . Charging it like smartphones from 20 to 90% and getting about 1 week to 10 days of battery life with intense usage. Charging takes about 50 mins for the above session.5. Comfort - 4/5 nice padded ear cups, but brings sweat quickly and then feels a bit warm... But prolonged usage doesn't hurt that much as once i had used it about 2hrs at a single strech.6. Connectivity- 5/5 very strong bluetooth connectivity, works seamlessly even with 10 meters of distance with walls and different floors.But still not that useful for online gaming via wireless mode as it has a little bit of latency.Cons. :-1. Crap when connected to PC via wire and headset turned off.2. Like other over the ear, gets uncomfortable in scorching summer and humid conditions.3. Lack of ldac , hence no hi-res audio, but in this price bracket it's ok.4. Though doesn't feel cheap, but some aesthetics should be there.Verdict:- You can absolutely go with it if you are getting it around 6000/- for no specific taste. Don't expect it to outperform those ult or XMs, it's illogical to think. If you want the ultimate one then there are XM, momentum, quitecomfort or those beyerdynamics....instead of going with intermediates, either go with this one or go with those super expensive ones. And those people comparing it with much lower priced headphones and saying it worse, they simply don't have the sensitivity to differentiate between subtle frequencies, and those subtle frequencies make it sweet.'Made for iPhone/iPod' written on the outside of the box, which is strange, probably will work better with ios than android. I'm an android user (pixel) though:).At last, it's a sweet headphone.Those images are after 6 months of usage!!

Product_Name: Sony WH-CH720N Noise Cancellation Wireless Bluetooth Over Ear Headphones with Mic, Up to 50Hrs Battery- Black
Review_Text: I've been using it for a while and I'm satisfied with the sound quality and the noise cancelling. It has good enough passive noise cancelling already for everyday use and the active noise cancelling makes it amazing to use in noisy environments like a flight or train or even a really loud fan in your room. Music quality is not 'amazing' but it's better than most and nothing to complain about. Battery life is good, and charges back up pretty quick too. Buttons are easy and intuitive to use. Fit and comfort is there, it's closed back so might be uncomfortable to use in hot/humid conditions.One thing I'm most impressed about is the bluetooth range,  I can keep my phone in my room and walk around wearing the headphones to the next room or the bathroom and it loses no signal, it's great. The strong bluetooth signal unfortunately seems to mess with wifi though, so I see some reduction in wifi speed when this is connected. Could just be a weakness of the wifi chip in my old phone though.Another quirk is that by default only 2 noise cancellation modes - ambient, and NC (noise cancellation) - were available in the headphones. I had to install the sony headphones app to enable the 3rd mode - off - which is what I use most of the time. Ambient mode lets outside sound like voices in so you can hear people talking even when you're wearing the headphones, but outside of that it sounds noisy and I don't use it all that much. And NC mode is full noise cancellation. If you want to turn it off altogether and use it as a passive headphones you have to install the app and enable the 3rd option.Overall very happy with my purchase.

Product_Name: Sony WH-CH720N Noise Cancellation Wireless Bluetooth Over Ear Headphones with Mic, Up to 50Hrs Battery- Black
Review_Title: I am satisfied with my purchase.
Review_Text: I got it delivered to my home on 26th of October. Since then I am using it , I wanted to test it thoroughly before I write my review.Build quality: it is well build considering the price 8k which I paid. Though it is all plastic but it is by no means cheap at all. Fit and finish is top notch. The slider is also really good. No problem there.Padding is good too and it is comfortable to wear because it is light weight (187g).Try not to slide down unless your head is small or you are a female. The more you slide down, the more you will feel the pressure around your ears.It seems that it can last 8+ years easily if taken care of them.Suggestion: Buy a case for this, I bought it for 499 and it is perfect (UniGear Extra Hard Shell Headphone Carrying Case )Features and sound quality:Anc: you can expect around 50 to 60% reduction in sound. It's ambience mode is good but not really natural.Sound Quality: They are really good, not great though but definitely above average. You will feel worth spending 8,000. But above that might not be much of a value.Very crispy and crystal clear audio. Listen to all types of song and it absolutely fabulous. But listen through a good source I mean through Spotify or Apple music or any paid music platform then only you can actually hear the true sound quality.Equaliser: Download load the app and you can either use one of the presents it has in the app or you can make your own. I made my own ...0, +3, +6, +7, +5 and -1 ( bass) for clasic music and for other I like to have +3 (bass) with these settings.I find that these settings makes the mids more alive and clear.I didn't find any connection lost issue or any problem with the blutooth connection.I have watched 2 movies wearing these and the experience is almost like a little theatre. I mean you hear background in so much details, the bass and other sounds just perfect, making the watching movie a very delightful experience.I have sony earbuds wf-c500 and I find my recent purchase is an absolute upgrade. So definitely happy with my purchase.Hope I have covered everything.

Product_Name: Sony WH-CH720N Noise Cancellation Wireless Bluetooth Over Ear Headphones with Mic, Up to 50Hrs Battery- Black
Review_Title: Average at best, SONY's premium price
Review_Text: After much debating on cost to quality ratio between this, XM4 and XM5 (all Sony offerings) and reading tons of reviews here, I settled for this, since it seemed like a balanced option for non-audiophiles. After spending a good amount of time with them, I'm ready to share my thoughts.First and foremost, let's talk about what Sony has always been known for: sound quality. These headphones do not disappoint in this department. The audio is crisp, clear, and well-balanced, delivering a pleasurable listening experience across a variety of genres. The bass can be punchy but not overwhelming, the mids are smooth, and the highs are sharp without being piercing.Now, onto the aspect that was a bit of a letdown: the active noise-cancelling. The ANC is, to put it bluntly, below average. This is surely a disappointment since I have seen it struggle with noises even at home, including that of fan. Forget, if you TV on or anything, you would be able to hear all of those noises (though slightly suppressed). I have had ANC over ear headsets before. However, cross checking between this and them, I did feel this does perform slightly better, but that said, yes, dont expect the world to silent by any means. I also found that, though the headphones are light and comfortable, you will definately sweat in them and feel your ears burning after sometime, esp during summer and humid places.Another point worth mentioning, is I found, which i tilt or move my head, the ANC gets disturbed and you will occasionaly for split seconds notice background noises before ANC resumes again.The build quality of the headphones is solid, with a design that's sleek and minimalistic, and they are comfortable enough for long listening sessions (except summers maybe!). The battery life is also commendable, easily lasting through a full day of use. There is no case, so take good care of them!Multidevice works good and decent. There could be lags. I have noticed the headsets dont auto switch off (maybe during mutipoint connect).

Product_Name: Sony WH-CH720N Noise Cancellation Wireless Bluetooth Over Ear Headphones with Mic, Up to 50Hrs Battery- Black
Review_Text: It has everything you need in a headphone and that too with best Quality.Bluetooth connection is solid no issues as some were complaining about this issue. Sound quality just best and build quality is good. ANC is just fine could have been better, Ambient mode works like a charm and rest all are fine including battery life with more than 50 hours backup 🔥Price could have been a little lower ..Rest all iam fully satisfied

Product_Name: Sony WH-CH720N Noise Cancellation Wireless Bluetooth Over Ear Headphones with Mic, Up to 50Hrs Battery- Black
Review_Title: Good but read the following before you finalize it
Review_Text: After going through various reviews & videos the reason for me going for the Ch720n were three things : The durability, ease of use and sound quality.Kindly note the following pointers before you finalise this as your go to set of headphones :1. The sound quality out of the box is not great at all. I had to twerk the eq settings on the sony sound connect app before it started sounding better. The sound dramatically improved with my "Sound" app that's free on playstore.2. If you are into electronica or other modern bass heavy music, the bass becomes a bit too much for this set of headphones to handle.3. The build quality is excellent with soft cushiony earcups and the presence of physical buttons makes it easier for me to operate.4. The battery life is excellent and there are no complains regarding it.Overall, if you're looking for the best set of headphones under 10k, this would be it but I would still not be comfortable spending more than 6k on these. However, with the Soundcore space one as it's competitor in this price range which offers many features that this does not have, I would still opt for these solely because of the sound quality and durability.Peace

Product_Name: Noise 3 Wireless On-Ear Headphones with 70H Playtime, 40mm Driver, Low Latency(up to 45ms),Dual Pairing, BT v5.3 (Midnight Blue)
Review_Title: Dual pairing/auto connectivity is a SCAM
Review_Text:
DUAL PAIRING JUST DOESN'T WORK.
It automatically disconnects from one device in less than a minute.
Two devices dont stay connected for greater than a minute, the device in which media is not playing gets disconnected
To connect to the first device again
1) i have to disconnect from the second device
2) unpair(yes unpair) it from the first device
3) restart the headphones re-pair in the first device as if connecting for the first time to make it work
Repeat the same steps everytime you want to switch between devices.
After digging through reviews and comments on YouTube this is a issue with every unit not only mine
Also auto connectivity sometimes works sometimes doesn't work
Aux cable is a joke, only left side audio is delivered, the pin is too long to inside some devices so doesn't work on them
2000 rupees product advertised as bluetooth headphones having it's basic functionalities flawed is unacceptable.

Regarding sound quality: Its mediocre, there is a noticeable distortion at higher volumes, bass is non existent, even though I don't like bass that much there is serious lack of bass, i have to adjust it with equalizer to make it decent
Faint sounds are barely hearable even at max volume
This is my first time using headphones and i can figure out flaws quite easily
My rockerz 255 neo neckband has far superior sound quality
So anyone with even a remote love for audio quality or any dual device work should not consider buying this

Comfort : it's okayish,  i get sweaty inside earcups, for me it works like over-ear(completely covers from top to bottom end) but my ears are also very small in size
Weight is manageable(idk what to expect never used one before). It gets slightly uncomfortable after an 30 mins or so on ears. Personally i get jaw pain.
Battery : good
Build/Durability : good for now, also this is a
PU leather, it will wear and tear as usage continues + cushions doesn't seem replaceable (which is fine at this price)
Latency : good i would consider it for gaming, u will get used to it
In conclusion i regret buying it, i bought it mainly for long time usage and dual device connectivity, both of which are not full filled
Dont buy if you prefer dual pairing or audio quality.

Product_Name: pTron Tangent Eon in-Ear Bluetooth 5.3 Wireless Headphones, 45H Playtime, HD Mic & TruTalk AI-ENC Calls, Movie/Music Modes, Dual Device Pairing & Type-C Fast Charging & IPX5 (Dark Blue)
Review_Text:
Design and Build
The pTron Tangent Eon features a sleek and lightweight neckband design that provides a comfortable fit for prolonged usage. The earphones have magnetic earbuds, which make them tangle-free and easy to store. The silicone ear tips ensure a secure fit, making them ideal for workouts or daily commutes.
Sound Quality
For its price range, the Tangent Eon delivers decent sound performance. The audio output is bass-heavy, catering to users who enjoy a thumping beat in their music.
Connectivity
Equipped with Bluetooth 5.0, the earphones ensure quick and stable pairing with devices. The range is standard, offering uninterrupted connectivity within 10 meters.
Battery Life
One of the highlights of the pTron Tangent Eon is its battery life. The earphones promise up to 30 hours of playtime on a single charge, making them a great companion for long trips or extended use.

Product_Name: pTron Tangent Eon in-Ear Bluetooth 5.3 Wireless Headphones, 45H Playtime, HD Mic & TruTalk AI-ENC Calls, Movie/Music Modes, Dual Device Pairing & Type-C Fast Charging & IPX5 (Dark Blue)
Review_Text:
Ptron eon neckband ultimate choice for those who prefer necband
Design and Comfort: The neckband is designed for comfort during extended use, featuring an ergonomic in-ear design that ensures a secure fit.

Sound Quality: Equipped with 13mm dynamic drivers, the Tangent Eon delivers immersive stereo sound with deep bass, providing a satisfying audio experience for music enthusiasts.

Battery Life: One of its standout features is the impressive battery life, offering up to 45 hours of playtime on a single charge, making it suitable for prolonged use without frequent recharging.

Connectivity: The device utilizes Bluetooth 5.3 technology, ensuring a stable and efficient wireless connection with a range of up to 10 meters.

Additional Features: The Tangent Eon is IPX5 rated, providing resistance against sweat and light splashes, making it suitable for workouts and outdoor activities. It also supports dual pairing, allowing connection to two devices simultaneously, and features low latency mode for improved audio-video synchronization during gaming or video playback.

Pricing: As of january 2025, the pTron Tangent Eon is priced at ₹598 in India, positioning it as a cost-best effective option in the wireless earphone market.

I will give 10/10 best in class and price affordable must buy neckband

Review_Text:
I’ve been using these headphones for a few weeks now, and I’m genuinely impressed. The comfort level is outstanding—even after hours of wearing them, there’s no discomfort or pressure on my ears. The ear cushions are soft, and the fit feels just right without being too tight.

The sound quality is phenomenal. The clarity is crisp, and the bass is deep but not overwhelming. Whether I’m listening to music, podcasts, or watching movies, everything sounds immersive and well-balanced. Noise isolation is also excellent, allowing me to focus without distractions.

If you’re looking for headphones that excel in both comfort and audio performance, these are a perfect choice. Highly recommended!

Product_Name: HAMMER Bash Max Over The Ear Wireless Bluetooth Headphones with Mic, Touch Control, Deep Bass, Upto 40 Hours Playtime, Bluetooth 5.3, Workout/Travel (Cool Grey)
Review_Title: Honest Review: Hammer Blash Max - Premium Performance at an Unbeatable Price.
Review_Text:
I've been using the Hammer Blash Max headphones for a month, and they’re honestly a hidden gem. The sound quality is absolutely incredible – rich, deep, and crystal clear. The mic performs great, making calls smooth, and the sound isolation helps me stay focused on my studies. As a student, it's a perfect choice, especially when compared to brands like Noise or BoAt in the same price range. The premium feel of these headphones really stands out.

What really sets the Blash Max apart is the design. The 180-degree rotation ensures they stay safe from damage when not in use, unlike other headsets that can break or tilt. The soft cushions and matte finish make long online classes and study sessions comfortable. Plus, they're ideal for outdoor activities, traveling, and gym workouts – they won’t fall off like buds, which is a huge bonus. Covering the full ear, they provide a much better experience than typical on-ear headphones.

The build quality is fantastic, and the customer support team is quick and responsive if you ever need assistance. The only slight drawback is the charging time, but once charged, the call quality is premium and clear, and the music is immersive. What really impressed me is the touch controls – something you rarely find in other brands at this price. If you're looking for a durable, stylish, and functional headset, the Hammer Blash Max is the way to go!

Review_Text:

Being a tropical weather country with relatively high humidty this wear & tear is normal for which maufacturer ought to have made provisions for cushion replacement at reasonable cost. What's even more frustrating is that they don't have pan India service support. Only service centre is in Haryana.
I do not recommend anyone buy this. Reason for giving 4 star rating is for just the product and not for below average service support.

Product_Name: HAMMER Bash Max Over The Ear Wireless Bluetooth Headphones with Mic, Touch Control, Deep Bass, Upto 40 Hours Playtime, Bluetooth 5.3, Workout/Travel (Cool Grey)
Review_Text: Sound quality of headphones are best, Performance is totally good. Satisfied with the prouduct and charging speed is fast

Product_Name: Sony WH-CH720N Noise Cancellation Wireless Bluetooth Over Ear Headphones with Mic, Up to 50Hrs Battery- Blue
Review_Text:
I got this at 7999 with debit card cash back. I am using this since last 2 and a half weeks.
My review so far is:

Sound : 5/5
Build quality: 4/5
Mic quality: 3/5
Battery: 5/5
Volume control: 5/5
ANC: 4/5

I will rate this overall 4.5/5
I am not much bothered about mic quality because that’s not my primary use. I got this only for music and it’s serving up to the mark.
Duel device connection works well.
Battery life with ANC will declines little bit fast, although I am using it mostly without ANC.

ANC: It works just fine, it’s a budget ANC headphones so I don’t expect much. Those who have used proper ANC headphones might find this one less efficient. For me it works fine.

Music: Well what can I say? I had used sony a lot in the past, but was pre bluetooth era. This was really a great experience for me. EQ works really well and you can actually spot a difference when you adjust the difference. Sound is crisp and clear. You can really hear all the instruments clearly. Vocals are crispy too, not too much not less they have this little sweet spot! Bass is really great too, although you have to boost it a little bit, but basic settings may also work for you.

App: So far I found app working well, you can connect and disconnect devices within app as well. EQ settings work well too, you can basically create your own custom EQ ( recommended for audiophiles). App looks little cluttered I guess they will change it in future.

Volume: It is crazy loud given the size of drivers they have. I have only used it at 50% volume most of the time when I am at home, hardly went to 70% in public without any ANC. But I recommend you to use ANC if you are surrounded by too much noise in public.

Size and Fit :
These are over the ear, so they fit perfectly fine over your ears. I was actually surprised how good they fit over my ears. Cushions are very well made, have good texture and soft enough to not hurt your ears. The headphones are big enough to be recognised from a distance.

Downsides:
I really hoped they could have given carrying case because headphones themselves are sturdy but they still need protection while carrying.

Also these are not foldable, so carrying them can be little difficult, you may have to purchase a separate carrying case.

Product_Name: Sony WH-CH720N Noise Cancellation Wireless Bluetooth Over Ear Headphones with Mic, Up to 50Hrs Battery- Blue
Review_Title: Impressive Sound Quality and Decent Noise Cancellation
Review_Text:
I recently purchased this headphone and I must say, it has exceeded my expectations. The sound quality is truly remarkable, delivering a rich and immersive audio experience that brings my music and podcasts to life. Whether I'm jamming to my favorite tunes or engrossed in a podcast, the clarity and depth of the sound are truly impressive.

One of the standout features for me is the microphone's noise cancellation capabilities. While it may not completely eliminate all background noise, it does a commendable job of reducing ambient sounds during calls. The result is clear and crisp communication without the distractions of external noise. It's perfect for virtual meetings and online gaming sessions where effective communication is key.

The design of the headphone is sleek and comfortable, making it suitable for extended wear. The over-ear cups provide a snug fit without causing discomfort, and the adjustable headband ensures a customized and secure fit. The build quality also feels robust, indicating durability for everyday use.

I appreciate the user-friendly controls that allow me to adjust volume, skip tracks, and manage calls effortlessly. The Bluetooth connectivity is reliable, providing a stable connection with my devices without any noticeable lag.

Overall, this headphone is a solid choice for anyone seeking a combination of excellent sound quality and decent noise cancellation. It strikes a great balance between performance and affordability, making it a valuable addition to my audio gear. Highly recommended!

Product_Name: Sony WH-CH720N Noise Cancellation Wireless Bluetooth Over Ear Headphones with Mic, Up to 50Hrs Battery- Blue
Review_Title: Balanced sound output in this budget of 6190/-
Review_Text:
I am using it continuously for last 6 months and gave it 5🌟 overall for the things it offers in the price of just 6k... Yes 6k is just the initiation of good quality ANC bluetooth over the ear headset, people are expecting XM or bose or Sennheiser quality in 6k or 8k,lol....if it's in 8k or 10k range i would give it 4🌟 instead. Here's my findings —

Pros:-

1. Sound output - 4.5/5 ... Default sound is pretty flat, but quickly gets interesting after playing with eq, dsee, anc etc. . Sound volume is pretty average but distortion in max vol. is low. It's a general purpose headset, good enough for all aspects like rock, pop, bass,instrumental, classical, rap etc. . Seperation is nice, different tones have distinct identities. But for specific needs like for bass or vocal, strech your budget a bit more. I don't think you can get better than this balance of sound output in this budget.

2. ANC - 4/5 actually it's pretty decent, but could be a little better. Afterall it's an entry level ANC.

3. Built - 4.5/5 simplistic plastic built, no fancy cosmetics, but solid and mature, very much flexible, not gonna break anytime, good elasticity for sticking with head. Though it's plastic built but has stainless steel housing around stretchable arms which is very nice to have for long term usage. Most headsets break from this sections.

4. Battery- 5/5 fabulous battery life even with anc on . Charging it like smartphones from 20 to 90% and getting about 1 week to 10 days of battery life with intense usage. Charging takes about 50 mins for the above session.

5. Comfort - 4/5 nice padded ear cups, but brings sweat quickly and then feels a bit warm... But prolonged usage doesn't hurt that much as once i had used it about 2hrs at a single strech.

6. Connectivity- 5/5 very strong bluetooth connectivity, works seamlessly even with 10 meters of distance with walls and different floors.
But still not that useful for online gaming via wireless mode as it has a little bit of latency.

Cons. :-
1. Crap when connected to PC via wire and headset turned off.
2. Like other over the ear, gets uncomfortable in scorching summer and humid conditions.
3. Lack of ldac , hence no hi-res audio, but in this price bracket it's ok.
4. Though doesn't feel cheap, but some aesthetics should be there.

Verdict:- You can absolutely go with it if you are getting it around 6000/- for no specific taste. Don't expect it to outperform those ult or XMs, it's illogical to think. If you want the ultimate one then there are XM, momentum, quitecomfort or those beyerdynamics....instead of going with intermediates, either go with this one or go with those super expensive ones. And those people comparing it with much lower priced headphones and saying it worse, they simply don't have the sensitivity to differentiate between subtle frequencies, and those subtle frequencies make it sweet.
'Made for iPhone/iPod' written on the outside of the box, which is strange, probably will work better with ios than android. I'm an android user (pixel) though:).
At last, it's a sweet headphone.
Those images are after 6 months of usage!!

Product_Name: Sony WH-CH720N Noise Cancellation Wireless Bluetooth Over Ear Headphones with Mic, Up to 50Hrs Battery- Blue
Review_Text:
I've been using it for a while and I'm satisfied with the sound quality and the noise cancelling. It has good enough passive noise cancelling already for everyday use and the active noise cancelling makes it amazing to use in noisy environments like a flight or train or even a really loud fan in your room. Music quality is not 'amazing' but it's better than most and nothing to complain about. Battery life is good, and charges back up pretty quick too. Buttons are easy and intuitive to use. Fit and comfort is there, it's closed back so might be uncomfortable to use in hot/humid conditions.

One thing I'm most impressed about is the bluetooth range,  I can keep my phone in my room and walk around wearing the headphones to the next room or the bathroom and it loses no signal, it's great. The strong bluetooth signal unfortunately seems to mess with wifi though, so I see some reduction in wifi speed when this is connected. Could just be a weakness of the wifi chip in my old phone though.

Another quirk is that by default only 2 noise cancellation modes - ambient, and NC (noise cancellation) - were available in the headphones. I had to install the sony headphones app to enable the 3rd mode - off - which is what I use most of the time. Ambient mode lets outside sound like voices in so you can hear people talking even when you're wearing the headphones, but outside of that it sounds noisy and I don't use it all that much. And NC mode is full noise cancellation. If you want to turn it off altogether and use it as a passive headphones you have to install the app and enable the 3rd option.

Overall very happy with my purchase.

Product_Name: Sony WH-CH720N Noise Cancellation Wireless Bluetooth Over Ear Headphones with Mic, Up to 50Hrs Battery- Blue
Review_Title: I am satisfied with my purchase.
Review_Text:
I got it delivered to my home on 26th of October. Since then I am using it , I wanted to test it thoroughly before I write my review.

Build quality: it is well build considering the price 8k which I paid. Though it is all plastic but it is by no means cheap at all. Fit and finish is top notch. The slider is also really good. No problem there.

Padding is good too and it is comfortable to wear because it is light weight (187g).

Try not to slide down unless your head is small or you are a female. The more you slide down, the more you will feel the pressure around your ears.

It seems that it can last 8+ years easily if taken care of them.

Suggestion: Buy a case for this, I bought it for 499 and it is perfect (UniGear Extra Hard Shell Headphone Carrying Case )

Features and sound quality:

Anc: you can expect around 50 to 60% reduction in sound. It's ambience mode is good but not really natural.

Sound Quality: They are really good, not great though but definitely above average. You will feel worth spending 8,000. But above that might not be much of a value.

Very crispy and crystal clear audio. Listen to all types of song and it absolutely fabulous. But listen through a good source I mean through Spotify or Apple music or any paid music platform then only you can actually hear the true sound quality.

Equaliser: Download load the app and you can either use one of the presents it has in the app or you can make your own. I made my own ...
0, +3, +6, +7, +5 and -1 ( bass) for clasic music and for other I like to have +3 (bass) with these settings.

I find that these settings makes the mids more alive and clear.

I didn't find any connection lost issue or any problem with the blutooth connection.

I have watched 2 movies wearing these and the experience is almost like a little theatre. I mean you hear background in so much details, the bass and other sounds just perfect, making the watching movie a very delightful experience.

I have sony earbuds wf-c500 and I find my recent purchase is an absolute upgrade. So definitely happy with my purchase.

Hope I have covered everything.

Product_Name: Sony WH-CH720N Noise Cancellation Wireless Bluetooth Over Ear Headphones with Mic, Up to 50Hrs Battery- Blue
Review_Title: Big Hype for Big Price, Not recommended
Review_Text:
I bought this during the Great Indian Festival, and the price was slashed down to 7,998 from its usual price of 9,999. I also got a 10% discount on my SBI card, so the price was close to 7,190. Delighted with the deal, I ordered the black color as my favorite blue was priced 2,000 INR more. I got it delivered within two days, thanks to fast delivery by Amazon, of course, probably if you are a Prime member. After using it for the first 15 minutes, I wasn't quite impressed. I called Amazon Customer Care, but they refused to accept the return, so if you want to buy from Amazon, be sure to try it at a local Sony Shop or Mall if it's available there. So being unable to return the product, I was forced to continue with it, and here are the things I noticed:

Sound quality - To date, based on all the headphones and earphones that I have used, I think it is one of the best. I haven't used top-of-the-line headphones from Sony, Bose, Apple, etc., so the sound quality, based on my audio experience was pretty good. Also, some reviews say it is close to XM5, though there is a slight discernable difference in clarity.

Sony App and EQ Settings- I tried to fine-tune the music to my hearing taste, and the music sounded a bit better. The app asked for a picture of my ear to adjust the sounds according to the acoustics of my ears. I found these features a bit overhyped. While there were some changes in audio, and some features may indeed work, most of these things are hyped as stand-out features for marketing purposes to attract consumers. Also, I have tried using the headphones without these settings, and although there was some difference, it sounded good even without these fine-tunings.

ANC - It cancels out some noises in the background like the buzzing fan on my ceiling, but it's unable to cancel out the sound of my family members speaking around me, the TV audio (even though it is quite far in the drawing room and I am sitting in my bedroom), so it can cancel noise upto a certain degree beyond that it is of no use. I had watched a lot of Tech Reviews of various under 10k headphones before going for this one, they all have a similar problem, ANC works only up to a certain dB of noise, though it is understandable. If you want better ANC, probably go for higher-priced headphones.

Dual pairing and call quality - I use my headphones for many purposes like calling for meetings, listening to music, watching YouTube videos, movies, etc. So, a dual-pairing headphone would have been very much useful for me. While I considered this headphone, this was also one of the features that I had in mind. But the result was disappointing; dual pairing works, but the sound quality deteriorates severely. According to my research, in dual pair mode, it doesn't use the LDAC codec; rather, it uses the SBC/AAC codec, resulting in a deterioration of sound and call quality. In many cases, the person on the other side couldn't even hear clearly what I am saying. So, the call and music quality are both below average, or you may even say poor in dual pairing, which makes this feature irrelevant.

Connectivity - While in dual pair mode, it also experienced connectivity issues. There were times when the headphones got disconnected, and I had to manually switch or reconnect them. Contacting Amazon's customer care regarding this issue didn't help.

Battery life - Before I purchased this, I had seen tech reviews claiming it has amazing battery life. But when I used it (I use it for office work as well as for my entertainment, so I use it 8-12 hours a day), I found that the battery life is not that great. I use it without ANC most of the time as I am working from home. The battery ran for about 3-4 full days, which is 30-35 hours, much below what Sony claims.

Comfort - I have heard in many YouTube tech reviews that it is comfortable, but actually I found it quite opposite. In my opinion, ANC headphones under 10k are a big waste of money, especially if you are in hot and humid regions of India. The reason is that due to ear padding and isolation, your ears will heat up within 30 minutes and sweat, so you have to remove the headphones. Also, even though its padding is soft it's quite tight on the ear, and after 30 minutes of use, it causes discomfort, and you have to remove it.  So, I can't say it's very comfortable. Unless you are working in air-conditioning most of the time in hot and humid climate, it's better to look for TWS buds. If you are looking for noise-cancellation headphones, look for passive noise cancellation headphones that comes at much cheaper price with matching sound quality; there are a few below 3,000 INR which truly sound equally well.

So, to summarize - In my opinion, it is a big hype for the big bucks you spend. If you get this for more than 7,000 INR, it doesn't seem worth it unless you like the brand name. If you are keen on quality ANC headphones then raise your budget; otherwise, at this price, I don't think I am fully satisfied with what it offers.

Product_Name: pTron Tangentbeat in-Ear Bluetooth 5.0 Wireless Headphones with Mic, Deep Bass, 10mm Drivers, Clear Calls, Dual Pairing, Fast Charging, Magnetic Buds, Voice Assistant & IPX4 Wireless Neckband (Black
Review_Text:
I got it for 799/- within 24 hrs. Using it for 10 days now, don't have much complaints. I will sum up in pros and cons after my experience with the earphones. Reducing 1 star for the first CON in my review below.
PROS:
1) Cheaper than some of the other earphone brands with 12 months warranty as well.
2) Good Audio quality, I found it was better sounding than an Over the Ears Headphones I have from Cosmic Byte (G4000). Clear sound and good audio reproduction.
3) Battery life serves good at least for my taste as I am not a heavy user (I generally use it 2hours a day max.). Just FYI, I have charged the earphones twice in 10 days.
4) Comfortable earphones with very less weight and good ear fit.
5) Mic quality for calls is decent, not much noise cancellation for background noise but whatever is sent through is very clear and accurate.
CONS:
1) Biggest con for me personally is that I can't watch online youtube or twitch videos with this one (usually have to go 360p or lower for smoother experience) as it hampers the wifi speed on my mobile when connected to the mobile via bluetooth. This is happening because my wifi router is 2.4Ghz and it is interferring with the bluetooth signal to reduce internet speeds. A simple 5Ghz router would solve this issue, but as I don't have it, its become an issue. Also, I can tell if you run videos from mobile internet then you don't face this issue.
2) Only SBC bluetooth audio format supported hence not the best audio quality.
3) Left and Right ear plugs always confuse me while wearing it on, also the length of left and right side is not exactly the same, slight mismatch is present, which goes to show poor quality checks from the company.
4) Battery life could have been better or atleast charge time should have been reduced. It takes 1.5 hrs charge time for 6-8hrs battery life.
5) Battery indicator is very wrongly calibrated. From 100 to 70% discharging, it takes 5-6 hrs playtime, while from 70 to 10% it takes just 30 odd minutes. This again shows poor quality checks from the company.

Product_Name: soundcore Life Q30 by Anker, Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones with Multiple Modes, Hi-Res Sound, Custom EQ via App, 50H Playtime, Comfortable Fit, Bluetooth, Multipoint Connection
Review_Title: Confortable headphones, but the bass boost is overly present.
Review_Text: [I've edited this review after some time spent with the headphones]At first, being used to very neutral/transparent headphones, I got very shocked by the loudness of the low end on these. I'm still using an external software to adjust the equalization as the low end is too pronounced for my taste and seems overly present even for electronic music - I wish this feature was reduced in the future, or that an option to natively control it was given to the user.However, after two weeks of using, I noted several points that are very positive, which leads me to give a five-star review :- The headphones are really confortable and can be worn all day without fatigue.- The overall quality of sound (minus the bass being too present) is excellent for an item at this price (currently 7k).- The noise cancellation feature is quite weak in the treble, but works well with the mids and lows, and gives a lot of confort even without playing music when in noisy environments.- The battery life, and especially the fast charge, are great. It really behaves as advertised. For someone like me who struggles with charging his devices other than last minute, I'm over the moon with the ability to plug it for a few minutes and get a decent lifespan, enough to do a normal commute or fall asleep to music for example. That's really a gamechanger from other BT headphones I had before- The customer service is excellent and very reactive. I must say that for a product priced so competitively, I didn't not expect this quality of service.So all in all, after a second thought, I'm really recommending this product to anyone looking for a good price/quality headphones.

Product_Name: soundcore Life Q30 by Anker, Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones with Multiple Modes, Hi-Res Sound, Custom EQ via App, 50H Playtime, Comfortable Fit, Bluetooth, Multipoint Connection
Review_Text: I initially purchased the Soundcore Life Q30 headphones with high expectations due to their strong noise-cancellation features, good sound quality, and overall comfort. However, it didn’t take long for me to realize that durability is a major issue with this model.After a few months of use, the headphones developed significant structural problems that many other users around the world have also reported – a quick search online will reveal countless similar complaints. This is not an isolated issue and appears to be a widespread defect. Given the frequency of these complaints, I strongly advise potential buyers to reconsider purchasing this product.While the sound quality and features are impressive for the price, what good is a product if it doesn't last? Until Soundcore addresses these durability problems, I cannot recommend the Q30 to anyone.

Review_Title: Top-Notch Sound and Comfort at an Amazing Price
Review_Text: I’m absolutely impressed with the ZEBRONICS THUNDER! The sound quality is outstanding, with deep bass and crystal-clear audio that enhances my music and movie experience. The Bluetooth 5.3 connectivity is seamless, offering a strong, stable connection without any lags.The design is sleek and lightweight, making it super comfortable for long hours of use. The battery life is another highlight—it lasts for hours on a single charge, which is perfect for both work and leisure.Overall, this is a fantastic headphone for the price, delivering premium features without breaking the bank. Highly recommended for anyone looking for reliable wireless headphones!

Review_Text:
Damn I have been eyeing this for over 8-9 months and was sceptical to buy it because of the pricing. Finally I took a risk and bought it and following are my thoughts after using it for 10 to 15 days:
This price paid is worth every penny. These are truly another level of music sensation and vibe. If you are a bass lover and want something like "a portable or chalta firta woofer" buy this without a second thought. The punches are to a different level and trust me once u put them on, you Nirvana zone starts.
It has taken bass to another level and with the music clarity it produces is nothing compared to anyone as yet which I have used.
The voice controls are amazing.
The crusher is totally on a different horizon.. .the way it soothes you ears and the feel and vibe it will give you is from another world. You wouldn't want to plug inn anything else once you wear these.
I'm not a techie guy so won't push my review that way but this is worth every damn penny in short. Buy it without a second thot...

Product_Name: Skullcandy Crusher ANC 2 Over-Ear Noise Cancelling Wireless Headphones with Sensory Bass | 50 Hours Battery Life |Skull-iQ, Alexa Support, Micro, Bluetooth Compatible - Black
Review_Title: Indeed a skull crusher in a good way !!!
Review_Text:
First of all these are excellent set of headphones

There are no indian reviews yet on these headphones on youtube but lemme tell you,this is one of the most finest headset out here recently.
I am a bass lover. I was very skeptical to buy between momentum 4's or crusher anc 2. I went with these headphones and they sound beautiful. They really crush the head off in a good way with that thumpy bass wheel.
If u are base lover , just go for it without a 2nd thought. Your skull will literally rattle.You will fell like there are 2 subwoofers of car or dj system attached on your skull
I use this for playing pubg keeping audio codec in developer options to sbc.latency becomes low and enemy steps separation in game is also there.

I have bose qc earbuds and their sound is amazing but when i put on these headphones with bass wheel keeping to just on 60 percent i was literally amazed.Now i am not using my bose.Lol. This headphone is now my daily driver.I didnt expected the sound to be so good.

Please note - Use the feature of SOUND BY MIMI(personal sound). It really made the sound very good in every aspect for my ears.

I also use it for jogging in park.
The bass which is felt during song is really out of this world.
I played a mixture of bollywood, hollywood songs and this headphone sounded good for mostly all types of songs.no complaints.
I watched some hollywood movies and i felt every gun shot from movie directly in my head because of the sensory bass.
Even latency for games is low.
One of the best headphones in market.One of its kind.

Even audiofiles can use it for fun. The sound is not audiophile grade but anyways everyone can have fun with these cans if u r a basehead.

Review_Text:
I recently purchased the Ambrane Stringz 38 Wired Earphones, hoping for a decent audio experience. Unfortunately, they fell short of my expectations.
The sound quality was underwhelming, with a lack of clarity and depth. The bass was weak and overpowered the other frequencies. The tangle-free cable was a convenient feature, but it didn't compensate for the poor audio quality.
While the in-ear fit was comfortable, the overall build quality felt cheap and flimsy. The earphones didn't feel durable, and I was concerned about their longevity.
If you're looking for reliable and high-quality wired earphones, I would recommend exploring other options. The Ambrane Stringz 38 Wired Earphones simply didn't meet my standards.

Review_Text: Value for money in terms of product quality.

Product_Name: pTron Tangentbeat in-Ear Bluetooth Wireless Headphones with Mic, Punchy Bass, 10mm Drivers, Clear Calls, Dual Pairing, Fast Charging, Magnetic Buds, Voice Assist & IPX4 Wireless Neckband (Dark Blue)
Review_Text:
I got it for 799/- within 24 hrs. Using it for 10 days now, don't have much complaints. I will sum up in pros and cons after my experience with the earphones. Reducing 1 star for the first CON in my review below.
PROS:
1) Cheaper than some of the other earphone brands with 12 months warranty as well.
2) Good Audio quality, I found it was better sounding than an Over the Ears Headphones I have from Cosmic Byte (G4000). Clear sound and good audio reproduction.
3) Battery life serves good at least for my taste as I am not a heavy user (I generally use it 2hours a day max.). Just FYI, I have charged the earphones twice in 10 days.
4) Comfortable earphones with very less weight and good ear fit.
5) Mic quality for calls is decent, not much noise cancellation for background noise but whatever is sent through is very clear and accurate.
CONS:
1) Biggest con for me personally is that I can't watch online youtube or twitch videos with this one (usually have to go 360p or lower for smoother experience) as it hampers the wifi speed on my mobile when connected to the mobile via bluetooth. This is happening because my wifi router is 2.4Ghz and it is interferring with the bluetooth signal to reduce internet speeds. A simple 5Ghz router would solve this issue, but as I don't have it, its become an issue. Also, I can tell if you run videos from mobile internet then you don't face this issue.
2) Only SBC bluetooth audio format supported hence not the best audio quality.
3) Left and Right ear plugs always confuse me while wearing it on, also the length of left and right side is not exactly the same, slight mismatch is present, which goes to show poor quality checks from the company.
4) Battery life could have been better or atleast charge time should have been reduced. It takes 1.5 hrs charge time for 6-8hrs battery life.
5) Battery indicator is very wrongly calibrated. From 100 to 70% discharging, it takes 5-6 hrs playtime, while from 70 to 10% it takes just 30 odd minutes. This again shows poor quality checks from the company.

Product_Name: PTron Boom Ultima 4D Dual Driver, in-Ear Gaming Wired Headphones with in-line Mic, Volume Control & Passive Noise Cancelling Boom 3 Earphones - (Dark Blue)
Review_Text: So first, let's talk about the external-Bulid quality is awesome 9/10 even at such an affordable price.Looks-I have all 3 colours of these earphones and all colours looks coolWire-the wire quality is 9/10. I have these earphones from 4 months and these haven't tangled since. Also the rubber coating and the inside braided wires gives a nice  looking effect.But 1 thing I have seen is the middle piece which have a mic and buttons is 180 degree reversed. so, many times it's difficult to pick the right or left earphone without seeing. But it is mentioned on the earphones so that becomes easy.Now about the main part the internalsThe sound quality is so so nice. 😊As you can see in my title. Solid 8/10. You can listen any music like lofi or peacefull type and when it's time for a party you can listen rock, bass boosted songs with such a adorable quality its the true definition for true sound and at cheap prices.Bass quality is also good.perfect for the ears. And if u want high bass, I tried it with max bass it can produce and that's awesome. But don't listen high bass for long. Those can hurt ur ears really bad.But noice cancellation is 4/10.seems like there is no noice cancellation. Maybe its mentioned for the mic not for the earpiece.Obviously there are very high quality products then this product but those will alteast cost 2000. Product_Name: PTron Boom Ultima 4D Dual Driver, in-Ear Gaming Wired Headphones with in-line Mic, Volume Control & Passive Noise Cancelling Boom 3 Earphones - (Dark Blue)
Review_Title: Just a Good to have and use Headphone
Review_Text:
Let me get straight to the point, this is a good to have wired headset. Music quality is Good, Bass is not a thumping one, you will have to press them hard into the ear to feel it but then slowly your ears will start paining. Treble is ok. Mid Ranges take priority.

If you enable EQ with higher bass and increase the volume above 75%, you can get a good ear massage as the whole unit starts vibrating with a bad output.

I am using this with a Redmi Note 8 Pro with PowerAmp.

> I don't know anything about the workings of the Noise cancellation properties in this headset. I have used noise cancelling headphones earlier and this has nothing of that sort.
> the earphones are too delicate, I am not sure they will take the beating of a harsh use.
> purchased it for Gym use, has no clip to hold the microphone unit in place.

But given the price point I would go for it again if available for the same cost. Overall I rate it 4 stars.

Review_Text:
My observations.
Thanks to ammazon and the seller, got delivery within 12 hrs.
I expected alot more in sound quality, but was disappointed for the price paid. Using it now for over 2 weeks and the battery is still going strong. Do not expect fireworks from the sound which is tuned a bit above neutral hence i found it bassy with less treble but music and vocals are extremely clear. These hp definitely require a burn in for a few hours and are now sounding a bit better. The earcups are small and you need to adjust your ears to them. It does get uncomfortable after about 90 mins and if you sweat, god save you. The ANC is a joke and is utterly useless as even with it on you can hear everything. However, with ANC off, the audio is horrible. You feel as if you are listening to a rs. 200 hp. With ANC on, the sound gives you the oompf. Bluetooth connection is great.
Overall, these hp are not worth the full price of 14000 even at the discounted price of 8000 not that good. A sony or skullcandy sounds better. It does serve the purpose of good sound at times. If they sell for lower than 7000 then go for it.
I expected more from these hp but was disappointed.

Product_Name: Sennheiser HD 450BT (ANC) Bluetooth 5.0 Wireless Over Ear Headphone with Mic, Designed in Germany, Alexa Built-in - Active Noise Cancellation, 30h Battery,Fast Charging, Foldable, 2Yr WARRANTY - Black
Review_Title: Worth three star at the level of current product design and quality
Review_Text:
Sound quality - I can give 4 or 4.5 star for sure.
Customisation thru official android app - good part of the buy
Got it around 6300 INR during sale, another good part. and i still feel i should have got a better product in such spending. Neverthless, i wont really pay anything more than 6 for such product. (talking in Hindsight)
Quality of music is the same in bluetooth and also wired mode.Please note - the aux cable is not normal aux cable - it is extremely customised for the headphone. So, dont lose it or break it. You will feel the pinch to shell out few dollars for buying another one from the company. No option!

Cons
1. It will pain after an hour or two.
2. Can't use if for long period, unlike some reviews mentions so which i feel is completely wrong. And i still wonder how they could have written that thing in their review.
3. It says 30 hours battery, but I dont think it lasts longer than 15-17 hours. Am damn sure it wont last beyond 20 hrs.
4. The pouch that comes along with the product is literally useless. The customer will be pleased if a good pouch that can really protect the product while carrying it and it will make total sense to bundle it with the product.
5. ANC is a joke. (I have borrowed words of other reviews as i felt the same)
6. The ear cushions could have been better and little larger to fit the earcups inside the cushions. The material seems to be not appropriate for hot geographical territories like India. I certainly feel it sweats a lot after wearing it for 45 mins or so on a continuous basis.
7. The loudness could have been slightly higher, but it's ok with current level. But it could have been better.

Product_Name: Sennheiser HD 450BT (ANC) Bluetooth 5.0 Wireless Over Ear Headphone with Mic, Designed in Germany, Alexa Built-in - Active Noise Cancellation, 30h Battery,Fast Charging, Foldable, 2Yr WARRANTY - Black
Review_Text:
It's not like those high end headphones but if you are daily driving these then they are amazing and the audio is decent.

Moreover I'm impressed with the battery life. You can easily sail through a day with full charge. For me it takes about 2 hours to fully charge from 10%.

However the active noise cancellation is not that good. But I rarely use that feature so I can't say a lot about it.

When it comes to comfort, they are just amazing for me. It won't be the case for everyone but I can spend a long period of time with these on my head without any problems.

Product_Name: Sennheiser HD 450BT (ANC) Bluetooth 5.0 Wireless Over Ear Headphone with Mic, Designed in Germany, Alexa Built-in - Active Noise Cancellation, 30h Battery,Fast Charging, Foldable, 2Yr WARRANTY - Black
Review_Title: A great set of headphones, with some scope of improvement!
Review_Text:
Look and feel: Really classy and minimal design. It's not a head-turner, but it looks quite premium. Yes it's all plastic, but the good quality type. Great decision to have the outside ears be empty and have a matte finish.

Fit and Portability: Very tight and snug fit, with holes that are surprisingly small for an 'over ear' headphone. People with big heads or ears might face some discomfort with long usage, but for the majority it should be absolutely fine. It folds up into a small form factor, and comes with a decent carry case for daily use. Sadly, the ear cups don't completely swivel, which makes carrying it around on the neck slightly uncomfortable.

Sound: Compared to it's competitors (Sony, Soundcore), it has a neutral sound signature, with a mild bass boost. Not recommended for those who want thumping bass, but for everyone else it's a pleasant sound.  Sound quality is brilliant as expected from Sennheiser, as long as you're using the higher quality Bluetooth codecs (Aptx for Android and AAC for Apple/Windows). Pro tip - Use the app "Wavelet" if you have an Android phone, you can use the AutoEQ feature to smoothen out the sound even more!

Mic: Same as most Bluetooth headphones. Good enough for phone/video calls but don't expect to go and record anything serious with it.

Noise Cancellation: ANC performance is above average. It will block out most of the droning, lower pitched sounds (ACs, Car Engines etc.), but you can still hear people talking and other higher pitched sounds. Lack of a "transparency mode" outside of phone calls is a negative, hopefully it's available later with a firmware update.

Controls: Slightly challenging to initially learn (lots of buttons bunched together), but it's pretty logical, and eventually you'll get a hang of it. Voice Assistant button works as expected, as long as it's properly setup.

Battery: Holds up to the claimed 30 hours quite easily. As long as you're charging it every few days, you never have to worry about it running out.

App: Thankfully, Sennheiser are pretty good at keeping the smartphone app maintained and regularly updated. The app recently got an overhaul, and the headphones got a firmware update that added a feature (Sidetone). Wish there were more options for EQ rather than a simple 3 band thing.

Price: The SE model (which I have) is great value for money; a newer model in a cheaper price. The regular 450BT seems slightly overpriced, as it's older, yet more expensive.

Overall, the 450 has both pros and cons, but it comes out as a net positive. It's a good  recommendation for an entry level ANC device, that offers Sennheiser's trust and quality.

Respectable competitors in the 8-10k price range (as of writing this review) are the Sony WH-CH710N and Soundcore Q35. Do check them out before making a purchase.

Product_Name: Sennheiser HD 450BT (ANC) Bluetooth 5.0 Wireless Over Ear Headphone with Mic, Designed in Germany, Alexa Built-in - Active Noise Cancellation, 30h Battery,Fast Charging, Foldable, 2Yr WARRANTY - Black
Review_Title: Best Noise Cancelling Headphones in under 10k!
Review_Text:
I was looking to buy a noise-cancelling, wireless heaphone which enabled me to attend my work calls, listen to music and watch videos every now and then. After researching for a bit, I zeroed in on this piece of beauty.

Here's my user experience having used it for over 3 weeks now.

1. The sound quality is 9/10. The output is well balanced as per my liking.

2. Noise-cancellation works really well. It doesn't block out the entire outside noise but does a great job cancelling out the ambient noise in my room, especially the AC humming. I would rate this 9/10!

3. The microphone quality is pretty good for calls. The speech as well as any musical instrument sound is transmitted pretty well. I would rate it 8/10!

4. The battery life is brilliant. This headphone stays connected to the laptop or my phone for 12-14 hours a day. A full charge easily lasts me 3-4 days of functioning before it needs to be recharged. I would rate it 9.5/10!

5. The Bluetooth connectivity is amazing. I could easily move around in my house to the rooms where the WiFi signal struggles to reach, but this headphone stays connected without a drop in the connectivity. I would rate this 9.5/10!

6. Lastly, the build quality is quite good. The cushioning of the band above the head is just about right. While, the cushioning of the earmuffs are perfect! They neatly cover my earlobes and doesn't cause too much discomfort when wearing them for long hours. The clamping force is not too tight. The only time I had to move them was to wipe off sweat.

In summary, I would recommend this headphone to whoever is looking to buy a noise-cancelling, wireless headphone in under 10k budget. There are other brands available with similar products, but I tend to gravitate towards Sennheisers as this is my 4th Sennheiser product and they usually last quite long, depending on how you use it.

Product_Name: Sennheiser HD 450BT (ANC) Bluetooth 5.0 Wireless Over Ear Headphone with Mic, Designed in Germany, Alexa Built-in - Active Noise Cancellation, 30h Battery,Fast Charging, Foldable, 2Yr WARRANTY - Black
Review_Title: good for the price, noise cancellation is bad and makes things worse
Review_Text:
BAD:
1. this sequeezes your head a lot, you either have to get used to it, or not buy this at all.
2. noise cancelling just doesn't work. turning it on adds some white noise to the music or whatever is playing and that is effective in eliminating nothing.
3. turning on noise cancellation makes the music sound bad.
4. volume on wired connection is more than than when listening on wireless.
5. battery percentage is shown only in multiples of 10. i.e., only 60%, 70%, 80% etc, nothing in between 70 and 80, or 60 and 70.
6. no latency can be observed on bluetooth 5+ devices(with iphone 12), but older devices with bluetooth 4+ has latency issues, with both devices playing from same distance.
7. connection drops at times.
8. multi-device feature is useful, but headphone can't switch between devices instantly, needs 3-4 seconds. this is an issue because, when you are listening to something on computer and you get a phone call, you can instantly take the call. but, the case with media(e.g, music) is different. when multiple devices are connected and you are playing something on one device and then you play something on 2nd device, it just plays but you can't hear that and you will be listening to sounds from 1st device. there is neither indication on your 2nd device it can't be played, nor does the headphone switches to second device. for headphone to passthrough properly. you first need to pause/stop sounds from 1st device, then wait a couple of seconds and then start playing on 2nd device.
9. the ear cups can't accommodate adult's ears. they are too small and will squash you ears.
10. i don't know if this is happening only with me, but my left ear touches the insides of earcups, which doesn't happen from the right earcup.
11. the slider needs hard drags to function, for ex, to change tracks, to take calls.
12. lot of voice prompts for the playback time left. this gets frustrating if you use this for long sessions.
13. heard from a friend who used 4.5BT for around 2 years that the sweat will tear aprat the ear cushions. so, a big no-no for long sessions. and on amazon, ear cushions selling at 23-27% of the actual product is ridiculous(i bought 450SE for INR 7,490).

GOOD:
1. sound quality is very good for the price.
2. microphone quality is acceptable for phone calls and zoom, but nothing more. microphne sounds quiet on older devices with bluetooth 4+, but has acceptable volume with bluetooth 5+ devices.
3. wired passthrough feature has to be my favourite.
4. battery life is adequate. i have only had to charge this around once every 3-4 days with headphone turned on for around 10 hours every day and with 0-2 devices connected and playing for at least half of that time.
5. build is good, so i presume this is going to last long squeezing my ears and head.

P.S: bluetooth 5 device is iphone 12 and bluetooth 4 device is my 3-year old computer.

Product_Name: Sennheiser HD 450BT (ANC) Bluetooth 5.0 Wireless Over Ear Headphone with Mic, Designed in Germany, Alexa Built-in - Active Noise Cancellation, 30h Battery,Fast Charging, Foldable, 2Yr WARRANTY - Black
Review_Text:
The headphones sound good. But that's the only and not that major plus point of these headphones. (My 2K worth earbuds sound same or even better in some scenarios. 😑)

One of the worst Bluetooth connectivity I've seen on an audio device. It let's you connect 2 devices simultaneously but if one of them get's out of range or disconnect, the headphones will continuosly tell you "LOST CONNECTION". And this can only be stopped if you reconnect the device or turn off the headphones.

There is no Noice Cancellation. So don't buy these is you want good noice cancellation. (ANC gets good as you pay more, note it down).

If you connect to a device specially laptop, you need to be in range of within one meter to stay in connection! With that frustration you end up using the wired connection! I paid nearly 9K for a wireless Bluetooth headphones, but if I have to use wire then what is the benefit here.

The mic is good though, on calls the person on other end can hear you clearly. 👍

And, the app does nothing. I have received only one firmware update in 3-4 months. So if you not use the app then you are not missing much.

Finally I would not recommend these headphones. Buy any other cheaper headphones as there is no differentiation with these compared to other brands. You will not feel the "Sennheiser" quality in these.

Product_Name: Zebronics Boom Wired Headphone, Over Ear, in-Line MIC, Foldable, 1.5 Meter Cable, for 3.5mm (Mobile | Tablet | Laptop | MAC), Soft Cushion, 40mm Drivers (Blue)
Review_Text:
I recently purchased the ZEBRONICS Boom Wired Headphone Over-Ear Headset, and let me tell you, it’s a hidden gem! At such an affordable price, I wasn’t expecting much, but boy, was I pleasantly surprised.

Build Quality: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ The headset feels surprisingly sturdy. The materials used are better than expected, and it doesn’t creak or feel flimsy. The adjustable headband fits comfortably, and the ear cups have just the right amount of padding.

Sound Quality: ⭐⭐⭐⭐ While not mind-blowing, the sound quality is definitely a notch above what you’d expect from a budget headset. It won’t replace your high-end audiophile gear, but for everyday use, it’s more than satisfactory.

Comfort: ⭐⭐⭐⭐ The ear cushions are soft, and the clamping force is just right. No sore ears here!

Comparisons: ⭐⭐⭐⭐ I’ve owned headsets from a tier above, and honestly, the ZEBRONICS Boom Wired Headphone holds its ground.

Final Verdict: If you’re on a tight budget but still want decent build quality and comfort, give the ZEBRONICS Boom Wired Headphone Over-Ear Headset a shot. You might be as pleasantly surprised as I was!
