Product_Name: JBL Tune 710BT by Harman, 50 Hours Playtime with Quick Charging Wireless Over Ear Headphones with Mic, Dual Pairing, AUX & Voice Assistant Support for Mobile Phones (Black)
Review_Title: Don't buy for the bass or built quality
Review_Text: This is my review of JBL Tune 710BT after one year of purchase.This was my first headphone purchase. I have only used earphones before. I'm writing this because I'm unsure what to expect for this price. I bought them for Rs.4000. In this one year, I can say that I have used these headphones a lot and have a few points to say about it.Pros -1. Battery life - They mention it's 50 hrs and it is. I have completed the series "Peaky Blinders" on a single charge with 20% battery remaining. That's some next-level battery life, considering the driver's size.2. Sound quality - The sound quality (excluding the bass) is pretty good, what some would say is a classic JBL signature.3. Comfort - It is very comfortable. As I said, I come from an earphone background, so it took a while to get used to it.4. Dual-device connectivity - This feature is a blessing and works effortlessly. But it only works effortlessly on Windows. I have an Android (Samsung) phone and tried connecting it with Windows(10/11) and Linux (Debian) systems as well. I faced some hiccups on the Linux side, but that can be due to incompatible audio drivers.5. Charging Speed - It takes more than an hour to charge from 0 to 100. But a quick 10-minute charge can last for hours.Cons -1. Sound quality (Bass) - It's too low. You can feel it only at higher volumes (>85%).2. Built quality - I don't know if I can expect a well-built headphone at Rs.4000. It is comfortable, but after a few hours of continuous usage, my ear gets sweaty, and I have to remove them for a few minutes. And all of this from staying indoors. DO NOT use this outdoors for jogging or running or at the gym. I tried my best to keep them away from sweat or wet hair, but as you can see from the photos, the leather (or whatever that material is) starts to deteriorate. The stitching of the right ear cup suddenly gave up one day. I tried to fix it using fevicol (glue), and you can see how they look from the photos.3. Over-the-ear - It is not over the ear. I have tried a few over-the-ear headphones, and this is not it. I think I have a decent-sized ear, and the rims of my ear touch and sometimes get folded by the inner cushion of the ear cups of this headphone. These are a little bit smaller to be called over-the-ear headphones.Conclusions -1. Don't buy this if you sweat a lot or plan to take this outdoors.2. Don't expect bass from it. My Rs.500 earphone (Realme Buds 2) has more bass than this.3. Other than bass, the sound is good.4. They are not fully Over-the-ear. So, some people might feel uncomfortable.5. A decent pair of headphones, but I expected a better-built quality for Rs.4000.

Product_Name: JBL Tune 710BT by Harman, 50 Hours Playtime with Quick Charging Wireless Over Ear Headphones with Mic, Dual Pairing, AUX & Voice Assistant Support for Mobile Phones (Black)
Review_Title: JUST GO FOR IT!! DONT LISTEN TO OTHER REWIEWS
Review_Text: I can't believe I almost cancelled this product checking other reviews saying it has low sound nd bass. So I had with 0 expectations reading the reviews I got it for a good price at 2800 so i just went for it.At first when I got the headphones I was dissapointed when I heard coz I put max volume on my phone nd the bass nd sound was low BUT THATS THE MISTAKE I THINK MOST PPL PUTTING THE REVIEWS COZ THATS DEFAULT SOUND which is very lowYou will have to put a song or play video it won't work otherwise AND THEN MANUALLY INCREASE THE SOUND BY CLICKING THE VOLUME BUTTONS ON THE HEADPHONES TILL U HERE A SOUND TICK SOUND WHICH MEANS IT REACHED MAX VOLUME.I did not know this I just found it and UFF the sound and bass increased SIGNIFICANLTY.SO REMEMBER TO DO THIS THIS WHEN U BUY THE HEADPHONESAfter doing that And you still want even more bass and sound then idk do you want ur head to explode or somethin coz it has VERY LOUD AND GOOD SOUND AND BASS!!OH Yes it's comfortable too not for too long but enough time life 5 or 6 hrs IF u have big ears it might hurt after sometime but for me it's PERFECT.

Product_Name: Noise Airwave Max 4 Wireless Over-Ear Headphones with 70H Playtime, ENC, 40mm Driver, Low Latency(up to 40ms), Dual Pairing, BT v5.4 (Carbon Black)
Review_Title: **Product Review: Comprehensive Look at These Budget-Friendly Headphones**
Review_Text:
After nearly a month of using these headphones extensively (10-12 hours daily), I can confidently say that they deliver impressive performance, especially considering the price range. Here’s a detailed breakdown of their strengths and minor drawbacks based on my experience.

### Comfort and Long Usage
One of the highlights is the comfort level; even after prolonged use, the fit remains snug without causing discomfort, which makes them ideal for long listening sessions. This aspect is especially notable given that many headphones in this range tend to fall short on comfort for extended wear.

### Sound Quality
The audio quality is balanced, with a satisfying clarity in both mids and highs. For casual listeners and music enthusiasts alike, these headphones provide a pleasant sound profile.

However, there are some nuances:
- **Volume and Sound Leakage**: The volume output is robust, though after the 50-60% mark, there’s noticeable sound leakage, which progressively increases as the volume rises. At full volume (100%), the sound is uncomfortably loud, and the bass becomes highly pronounced, creating a tactile vibration that can be felt upon touching the headphones. While this bass emphasis might appeal to bass lovers, it’s not ideal for balanced listening at maximum volume. Additionally, at this level, the leakage is substantial—effectively turning the headphones into mini speakers that can be heard across a room. This is not conducive to a private listening experience, but it is manageable when the volume is kept at 80% or below.

- **Low-Volume Performance**: On the flip side, these headphones perform admirably in quiet environments; I can listen comfortably at just 10% volume and still hear everything clearly, even in a room with background noise from a fan. For my regular usage, I find 30% volume is perfect for music, while 60% works well for videos and movies.

### Battery Life
Battery life is another area where these headphones shine. The manufacturer’s claim of 70 hours holds true. I’ve been charging them every 4-5 days despite rigorous usage, and they consistently deliver, making them reliable for extended listening sessions without frequent recharging.

### Dual Pairing Capability
A standout feature is the **dual pairing capability**, which works seamlessly. I can connect both my PC and mobile simultaneously, and the headphones automatically switch audio sources based on activity. When I press play on one device, media playback on the other device automatically pauses, ensuring a smooth, uninterrupted experience. Additionally, the headphones will automatically pause media playback if a call comes in, making them versatile and convenient for multitasking across devices.

### Controls and Connectivity
The buttons on the right side are intuitive and well-placed, making it easy to adjust volume, skip tracks, and take calls without fumbling. The included aux cable for wired mode works well for most setups, though the cable length may be a bit short for desktop connections.

### Value for Money
For their price range, these headphones are highly competitive. While other options might prioritize crowd-pleasing, bass-heavy sound profiles, these provide a more balanced output that doesn’t overshadow other frequencies. Combined with the impressive battery life, they stand out against alternatives that may compromise longevity for exaggerated bass.

### Final Verdict
For anyone looking for affordable headphones that don’t sacrifice sound quality or comfort, these are an excellent choice. They are especially suited for listeners who appreciate balanced sound, dual-device functionality, and long battery life. However, if you’re sensitive to sound leakage or plan to use them frequently at high volumes, this is something to consider. Overall, I would recommend these headphones for their solid performance and great value.

Product_Name: Noise Airwave Max 4 Wireless Over-Ear Headphones with 70H Playtime, ENC, 40mm Driver, Low Latency(up to 40ms), Dual Pairing, BT v5.4 (Carbon Black)
Review_Title: The best deal for headphones under 2300
Review_Text:
Its been around 10 weeks since i have bought these headphones and i have been using then daily since then while travelling in public transport and while doing a lot other works.I bought the white varient which gives it a premium look. here are some pros and cons i have noticed...

Pros:

*Build Quality: The body is made out of plastic which feels durable. The joints from where the headphones extends are made from plastic but reinforced with metal and gives a promising feel. Overall sturdy build for the price range.

*Battery Life: The battery lasts impressively long on a single charge – easily gets me through days without needing to recharge. for the fact i have recieved these headphones with around 70% charge and since then i have charged these headphones only twice that too only for around 30 mins.

*Sound Quality: The clarity and balance of sound is really good with Clear mids and highs. you can easily feel all the different instruments while listening to the music. The bass is also really good i wont say these are bass oriented headphones tho.

*Comfort: The fit is really good for my head and the headphones are Lightweight and actually comfortable for extended wear. you can easily bingewatch wearing them. Best thing is the Soft ear pads that don’t press too hard.

*Connectivity: Bluetooth connects instantly and Dual pairing works smoothly across my laptop and phone. although i have faced very few Dual pairing fails where it gets disconnected from both the devices and keeps on reconnecting untill you restart the connections.

Cons:

*Microphone: the microphone quality in these headphones are really bad and can sometimes be unusable if you are to talk slowly or when in outdoors

overall if your budget is around 2500....you can go for these headphones which were really good for music and movies. The surround sounds are just so good. but dont buy these if you need them for calls.

Product_Name: Noise Airwave Max 4 Wireless Over-Ear Headphones with 70H Playtime, ENC, 40mm Driver, Low Latency(up to 40ms), Dual Pairing, BT v5.4 (Carbon Black)
Review_Title: Amazing Sound Quality and Comfortable Fit - A Must-Have!
Review_Text: The sound quality is exceptional, with deep bass, crisp mids, and clear highs. Whether I'm listening to music or taking calls, the audio is always clear and immersive.The active noise cancellation feature is one of the best I've experienced in this price range. It effectively blocks out background noise, making it perfect for use in noisy environments like during commutes or at the office.Comfort-wise, these headphones are great for long listening sessions. The ear cushions are soft and snug, and the headband doesn't cause any discomfort, even after hours of use. Plus, the lightweight design makes them easy to carry around.The battery life is another strong point—I'm easily getting over 30 hours of playtime on a single charge, and the fast charging option is super convenient.Overall, the Noise 4 headphones offer fantastic value for money. They combine premium sound, great noise cancellation, and lasting comfort. Highly recommended for anyone in the market for quality wireless headphones!

Product_Name: Noise Airwave Max 4 Wireless Over-Ear Headphones with 70H Playtime, ENC, 40mm Driver, Low Latency(up to 40ms), Dual Pairing, BT v5.4 (Carbon Black)
Review_Title: Best Headphones in this price range
Review_Text:
The Noise 4 headphones have set a new standard for audio quality and comfort in their price range. From the moment you put them on, the plush ear cups provide a comfortable fit, making them ideal for extended listening sessions.

The sound quality is impressive, offering a well-balanced audio profile with clear highs, rich mids, and deep bass. Whether you're listening to classical music or modern pop, the Noise 4 delivers a dynamic range that enhances every genre. Active noise cancellation is effective, allowing you to focus on your music or calls without distraction.

Battery life is another standout feature, offering up to 30 hours of playback on a single charge, making them perfect for long trips or daily commutes. The intuitive controls and Bluetooth connectivity ensure a seamless user experience, and the built-in microphone provides clear voice quality for calls.

Overall, the Noise 4 headphones offer exceptional value for their price, combining high-quality sound, effective noise cancellation, and excellent comfort. They are a solid choice for anyone seeking an upgrade to their audio experience without breaking the bank.

Product_Name: Noise Airwave Max 4 Wireless Over-Ear Headphones with 70H Playtime, ENC, 40mm Driver, Low Latency(up to 40ms), Dual Pairing, BT v5.4 (Carbon Black)
Review_Text:
From the first listen, the Noise 4 Headphones impress with their rich, immersive audio. Whether you’re a bass lover or prefer crystal-clear vocals, these headphones cater to all types of listeners. The bass is deep and punchy without being overwhelming, making it perfect for electronic, hip-hop, or pop music.
It actively blocks out ambient sounds, whether you're in a crowded coffee shop or on a noisy commute. You’ll experience minimal distraction, allowing you to focus entirely on the music or calls.
The ear cushions are made from soft memory foam, providing a snug fit that you can wear for hours without discomfort.
Another notable feature is their portability. The ear cups swivel and fold flat, making them easy to store in a bag or carry case and with up to 70 hours of playtime, you won’t need to worry about charging frequently.

Product_Name: Noise 3 Wireless On-Ear Headphones with 70H Playtime, 40mm Driver, Low Latency(up to 45ms),Dual Pairing, BT v5.3 (Carbon Black)
Review_Title: Dual pairing/auto connectivity is a SCAM
Review_Text:
DUAL PAIRING JUST DOESN'T WORK.
It automatically disconnects from one device in less than a minute.
Two devices dont stay connected for greater than a minute, the device in which media is not playing gets disconnected
To connect to the first device again
1) i have to disconnect from the second device
2) unpair(yes unpair) it from the first device
3) restart the headphones re-pair in the first device as if connecting for the first time to make it work
Repeat the same steps everytime you want to switch between devices.
After digging through reviews and comments on YouTube this is a issue with every unit not only mine
Also auto connectivity sometimes works sometimes doesn't work
Aux cable is a joke, only left side audio is delivered, the pin is too long to inside some devices so doesn't work on them
2000 rupees product advertised as bluetooth headphones having it's basic functionalities flawed is unacceptable.

Regarding sound quality: Its mediocre, there is a noticeable distortion at higher volumes, bass is non existent, even though I don't like bass that much there is serious lack of bass, i have to adjust it with equalizer to make it decent
Faint sounds are barely hearable even at max volume
This is my first time using headphones and i can figure out flaws quite easily
My rockerz 255 neo neckband has far superior sound quality
So anyone with even a remote love for audio quality or any dual device work should not consider buying this

Comfort : it's okayish,  i get sweaty inside earcups, for me it works like over-ear(completely covers from top to bottom end) but my ears are also very small in size
Weight is manageable(idk what to expect never used one before). It gets slightly uncomfortable after an 30 mins or so on ears. Personally i get jaw pain.
Battery : good
Build/Durability : good for now, also this is a
PU leather, it will wear and tear as usage continues + cushions doesn't seem replaceable (which is fine at this price)
Latency : good i would consider it for gaming, u will get used to it
In conclusion i regret buying it, i bought it mainly for long time usage and dual device connectivity, both of which are not full filled
Dont buy if you prefer dual pairing or audio quality.

Product_Name: soundcore by Anker,Space One Active Noise Cancelling Bluetooth Over Ear Headphones with Travel Pouch,2X Stronger Voice Reduction,40H ANC Playtime,App Control,Ldac Hi-Res,Ergo Design for Comfort Fit
Review_Title: Confortable headphones, but the bass boost is overly present.
Review_Text: [I've edited this review after some time spent with the headphones]At first, being used to very neutral/transparent headphones, I got very shocked by the loudness of the low end on these. I'm still using an external software to adjust the equalization as the low end is too pronounced for my taste and seems overly present even for electronic music - I wish this feature was reduced in the future, or that an option to natively control it was given to the user.However, after two weeks of using, I noted several points that are very positive, which leads me to give a five-star review :- The headphones are really confortable and can be worn all day without fatigue.- The overall quality of sound (minus the bass being too present) is excellent for an item at this price (currently 7k).- The noise cancellation feature is quite weak in the treble, but works well with the mids and lows, and gives a lot of confort even without playing music when in noisy environments.- The battery life, and especially the fast charge, are great. It really behaves as advertised. For someone like me who struggles with charging his devices other than last minute, I'm over the moon with the ability to plug it for a few minutes and get a decent lifespan, enough to do a normal commute or fall asleep to music for example. That's really a gamechanger from other BT headphones I had before- The customer service is excellent and very reactive. I must say that for a product priced so competitively, I didn't not expect this quality of service.So all in all, after a second thought, I'm really recommending this product to anyone looking for a good price/quality headphones.

Review_Text: I initially purchased the Soundcore Life Q30 headphones with high expectations due to their strong noise-cancellation features, good sound quality, and overall comfort. However, it didn’t take long for me to realize that durability is a major issue with this model.After a few months of use, the headphones developed significant structural problems that many other users around the world have also reported – a quick search online will reveal countless similar complaints. This is not an isolated issue and appears to be a widespread defect. Given the frequency of these complaints, I strongly advise potential buyers to reconsider purchasing this product.While the sound quality and features are impressive for the price, what good is a product if it doesn't last? Until Soundcore addresses these durability problems, I cannot recommend the Q30 to anyone.

Review_Text: The Noise 3 Wireless Earphones are fantastic! The sound quality is impressive, with clear highs and deep bass, making them perfect for music, podcasts, or calls. They fit comfortably in the ears, even during long use, and the noise cancellation works well in busy environments. The battery life is great, lasting me through a full day without needing a recharge. Bluetooth connection is quick and stable. Overall it is best!

Product_Name: Noise 3 Wireless On-Ear Headphones with 70H Playtime, 40mm Driver, Low Latency(up to 45ms),Dual Pairing, BT v5.3 (Carbon Black)
Review_Title: Dual pairing/auto connectivity is a SCAM
Review_Text:
DUAL PAIRING JUST DOESN'T WORK.
It automatically disconnects from one device in less than a minute.
Two devices dont stay connected for greater than a minute, the device in which media is not playing gets disconnected
To connect to the first device again
1) i have to disconnect from the second device
2) unpair(yes unpair) it from the first device
3) restart the headphones re-pair in the first device as if connecting for the first time to make it work
Repeat the same steps everytime you want to switch between devices.
After digging through reviews and comments on YouTube this is a issue with every unit not only mine
Also auto connectivity sometimes works sometimes doesn't work
Aux cable is a joke, only left side audio is delivered, the pin is too long to inside some devices so doesn't work on them
2000 rupees product advertised as bluetooth headphones having it's basic functionalities flawed is unacceptable.

Regarding sound quality: Its mediocre, there is a noticeable distortion at higher volumes, bass is non existent, even though I don't like bass that much there is serious lack of bass, i have to adjust it with equalizer to make it decent
Faint sounds are barely hearable even at max volume
This is my first time using headphones and i can figure out flaws quite easily
My rockerz 255 neo neckband has far superior sound quality
So anyone with even a remote love for audio quality or any dual device work should not consider buying this

Comfort : it's okayish,  i get sweaty inside earcups, for me it works like over-ear(completely covers from top to bottom end) but my ears are also very small in size
Weight is manageable(idk what to expect never used one before). It gets slightly uncomfortable after an 30 mins or so on ears. Personally i get jaw pain.
Battery : good
Build/Durability : good for now, also this is a
PU leather, it will wear and tear as usage continues + cushions doesn't seem replaceable (which is fine at this price)
Latency : good i would consider it for gaming, u will get used to it
In conclusion i regret buying it, i bought it mainly for long time usage and dual device connectivity, both of which are not full filled
Dont buy if you prefer dual pairing or audio quality.

Product_Name: boAt Airdopes Progear Open-Ear Ear Buds for Outdoor Sports W/Air Conduction Tech, in Ear, 4 Mics W/Ai-Enx, 100Hrs Playback, 15Mm Drivers, Secure Fit,Beast Mode W/ 40Ms Latency, ASAP Charge Green
Review_Text: I had Shokz for 5 years and needed new not-in-the-year earphones.The design of the Airdopes Progear looked good on paper and the price was fantastic.I confess that I was skeptical about it, but wow, did they surprised me in a positive way?I run a lot and hands down that the boAt Airdopes Progear are better than Shoks with regards to comfort, battery life, sound quality and connectivity stability.The only thing to be confirmed is the durability. I hope they last but even if they go on for 5 years it is probably a good by.The only feature that annoys me is the fact that it always connects at full volume. Depending on the device can be seriously loud. Now I learned never to connect whilst wearing them.

Product_Name: boAt Airdopes Progear Open-Ear Ear Buds for Outdoor Sports W/Air Conduction Tech, in Ear, 4 Mics W/Ai-Enx, 100Hrs Playback, 15Mm Drivers, Secure Fit,Beast Mode W/ 40Ms Latency, ASAP Charge Green
Review_Text:
Disappointing Experience: Airdopes Progear

Rating: 1/5

I recently purchased the Airdopes Progear, expecting a high-quality audio experience. Unfortunately, this product has been a major letdown.

Poor Sound Quality:

The sound quality is subpar, lacking depth and clarity. The audio is tinny, with no noticeable bass. Even at maximum volume, the sound remains weak and unimpressive.

Key Issues:

1. No Bass: The absence of bass is staggering. Music and videos lack the punch and energy that bass provides.
2. Distortion: Audio distortion is noticeable, especially at higher volumes.
3. Muffled Sound: Voices and instruments sound muffled, lacking definition.
4. Unimpressive Treble: The treble is overpowering, making the overall sound unbalanced.

Design and Comfort:

While the design is sleek and compact, comfort is compromised. The earbuds feel bulky, causing discomfort during extended wear.

Battery Life:

Battery life is average, lasting around 4-5 hours on a single charge.

Connectivity:

Bluetooth connectivity is stable, but pairing can be finicky at times.

Conclusion:

The Airdopes Progear failed to meet my expectations. With poor sound quality, lack of bass, and uncomfortable design, I wouldn't recommend this product.

*Final Verdict:*

Avoid the Airdopes Progear if you prioritize sound quality. Invest in better alternatives for an immersive audio experience.

Product_Name: boAt Airdopes Progear Open-Ear Ear Buds for Outdoor Sports W/Air Conduction Tech, in Ear, 4 Mics W/Ai-Enx, 100Hrs Playback, 15Mm Drivers, Secure Fit,Beast Mode W/ 40Ms Latency, ASAP Charge Green
Review_Title: Very good out of ear headphones
Review_Text:
These earbuds are perfect if you want something comfortable that doesn’t go inside your ears. I love that I can still hear what’s happening around me, which is great when I’m out jogging or biking. The fit is secure, so they don’t fall out, even when moving around a lot. They’re also sweat-resistant, so they hold up well during workouts.

The sound quality is surprisingly good, with a nice bass kick, and calls are clear, even when I’m in a noisy place. The battery life is amazing—I’ve gone days without needing to charge them, and even if the battery’s low, a quick 10-minute charge gives you hours of playtime. The Bluetooth connects quickly and stays connected without any fuss, so it’s been really convenient.

There’s also this gaming mode that reduces the lag, which is cool for watching videos or gaming without that annoying delay. Overall, they’re a great option if you want comfy, high-quality earbuds that keep you aware of your surroundings, with lots of battery life to last through long days. For the price, I’d definitely recommend them!

Product_Name: boAt Airdopes Progear Open-Ear Ear Buds for Outdoor Sports W/Air Conduction Tech, in Ear, 4 Mics W/Ai-Enx, 100Hrs Playback, 15Mm Drivers, Secure Fit,Beast Mode W/ 40Ms Latency, ASAP Charge Green
Review_Title: Very Comfortable for all day usage, not recommended for very noisy environment
Review_Text:
Likes:
1.Very comfortable to wear all day long.
2. Light weight. Feel nahi hota kaan pr laga hua hai.
3. Keeps one fully aware of surroundings. Logon se aaram se baat kr sakte ho.
4. Decent battery backup. Lasts for around 12 hours. Can be used on one ear at a time. So usable time can be extended upto 50 hours with charging.
5. Sound quality is good. Though don't expect exceptional bass and treble (obviously) as it doesn't go inside ear canal and hence no chances of ear infection and irritation.
6. Great for working people.
Dislikes:
1. Uncomfortable to wear inside helmet
2. Cannot be used while riding 2 wheelers due to wind noise.
3. Touch functions not good. I prefer buttons.
4. Outside noise is a very big problem as it's based on open air conduction. So no question of any kind of noise cancellation.
5. Mic reception is weak for noisy places.

Matured logon ke liye badhiya cheez hai specially jinhein all day long calling ki zarurat hai.

Product_Name: Bose QuietComfort Ultra Bluetooth Headphones, Wireless Headphones with Spatial Audio, Over Ear Noise Cancelling Headphones with Mic, Up to 24 Hours of Battery Life, Diamond - 60th Anniversary Edition
Review_Text:
Got these for 24k during sale

1. Sound Quality: The sound is impressively balanced and clear, with bass that’s deep but doesn’t overpower the rest. Whether it’s classical or hip-hop, everything sounds crisp and full.

2. Noise Cancellation: Bose really nails it with the ANC—it’s strong but smart, adjusting as needed to block out the world. Transparency mode also feels natural, like you’re not wearing headphones at all.

3. Comfort: Super comfy! Lightweight with soft ear pads, these are perfect for long listening sessions without any ear fatigue.

4. Battery Life: Lasts up to 24 hours with ANC on, and a quick charge is there when you need it. Reliable for travel or just a busy day.

5. Connectivity: The Bluetooth is stable, and it can connect to two devices at once, so you can switch between your phone and laptop easily.

 Bose QuietComfort Ultra headphones hit all the marks clear sound, amazing noise cancellation, and lasting comfort. They’re a solid pick if you want premium headphones for serious listening.

The only reason People buy xm5s over these are because of xm5 got good quality mic if u take a lot of calls and you xm5s 10k less then these but ppl are crying on sony reddit because of xm5 hinge breaking issue and build quality
QC ultras are way superior in terms of everything else .

Product_Name: Bose QuietComfort Ultra Bluetooth Headphones, Wireless Headphones with Spatial Audio, Over Ear Noise Cancelling Headphones with Mic, Up to 24 Hours of Battery Life, Diamond - 60th Anniversary Edition
Review_Text:
I have been using the AirPods Pro 2 daily and the Shokz OpenRun for walks and the gym.

I was considering getting a pair of headphones (1) for better sound quality and (2) for better noise cancellation.

I went ahead with the purchase on October 19th at a price of approximately ₹22,000.

Mistakes/assumptions:

 1. A higher price means better performance: The AirPods Max still uses Apple’s H1 chip. Despite its exorbitant price, it doesn’t compete with the AirPods Pro 2, which uses the Apple H2 chip. Mark Ellis Reviews has done a video on this, and I compared sound quality reviews against these as a benchmark.
 2. Being a class leader in ANC means their sound quality must also be somewhat on par.
 3. Not doing A/B testing for sound quality before buying.

I was listening to music on my AirPods when I received the delivery. My first impression upon wearing the Bose QC Ultra was disappointment in how lackluster the sound quality was. I tried adjusting the EQ but didn’t notice much of an improvement.

I tried out its unique selling point (USP), Active Noise Cancellation (ANC), but it was nothing remarkable.

Immersive Audio: A gimmicky attempt at replicating Apple’s Spatial Audio. It sounds very processed and artificial, unlike Spatial Audio, which feels natural.

Popping sound when walking: There is a noticeable popping sound when walking, which makes the headphones usable only while at your desk. There is a Reddit thread indicating that this is a known issue.

Tips for achieving high-quality output:

 • On the Apple Music app, turn on Hi-Res Lossless.

TL;DR:

 • Noise cancellation: 8/10
 • Sound quality: 2/10
 • Spatial Audio (Immersive Audio): 1/10

In terms of sound quality, the AirPods Pro 2 and Shokz are in a different league compared to the Bose QC Ultra, which, even if sold for ₹5,000 to ₹8,000, is not worth the price.

Note: There are no returns after purchase.

Update : Bose is refusing to address the popping sound issue. Amazon will be checking with them and are expected to get back to me by 5th of November. Will update the progress here.

Product_Name: Bose QuietComfort Ultra Bluetooth Headphones, Wireless Headphones with Spatial Audio, Over Ear Noise Cancelling Headphones with Mic, Up to 24 Hours of Battery Life, Diamond - 60th Anniversary Edition
Review_Title: Great Sound, Comfort, ANC and Build Quality
Review_Text: If you’re on the fence, not sure about which high end headphone to buy, I’d highly recommend that you get the Bose QuietComfort Ultra. If you’re someone who likes to listen to a balanced sound signature as opposed to bass heavy headphones, then this is the perfect product for you. I am not saying that bass is poor on these headphones, you can definitely hear it but you may not feel that extra thump you might find on Sony products. The noise cancelling is just out of the world. For flights and long bus journeys, the headphones will drown out enough of the ambient noise to let you sleep peacefully. The ear cups and headband are soft and comfortable enough for long hours of listening. The ear cups are also really deep so most ear types won’t touch the driver enclosure. The Bose app is also well designed and easy to use. The immersive audio feature is great for certain songs and for watching shows, but it won’t work well with every song. I prefer to have it turned off to get more battery life. I can get a week’s worth of battery out of each charge (I listen to music for about 3-4 hours per day at 50-60% volume). The hinges and other components of these headphones feel sturdy and well built. You can go ahead and get these without a second thought. However, if you’re someone who makes a lot of phone calls from your headphones, or if you’re a bass head, you might want to consider other options like the XM5, since they have better microphones and a warmer, bass heavy sound signature.

Review_Title: Review of BOSE New Quite Comfort Ultra headphone
Review_Text:
The Bose Quiet Comfort Ultra headphones are an excellent choice for those seeking top-notch noise-cancellation technology. The headphones do a fantastic job of blocking out ambient noise, making them ideal for long flights or noisy work environments. The sound quality is also exceptional, with a well-balanced sound profile that delivers crisp highs and rich lows. Additionally, the headphones are comfortable to wear for extended periods thanks to their plush ear cushions and lightweight design.

One downside to the Bose Quiet Comfort Ultra headphones is the high price point, which may be a deterrent for some consumers. Additionally, some users have noted that the touch controls on the headphones can be finicky and difficult to use.

Overall, the Bose Quiet Comfort Ultra headphones are a great option for anyone looking for premium noise-cancelling headphones with exceptional sound quality and comfort. However, potential buyers should be aware of the higher cost and potential issues with the touch controls.

Product_Name: Bose QuietComfort Ultra Bluetooth Headphones, Wireless Headphones with Spatial Audio, Over Ear Noise Cancelling Headphones with Mic, Up to 24 Hours of Battery Life, Diamond - 60th Anniversary Edition
Review_Title: Light in weight, good in performance
Review_Text:
Am fond of Bose audio headphones, having used several Bose products over the last 15 years.
I’ve got this one just about 24 hrs back, thanks to Amazon Shopping Festival with Axis Bank credit card, I landed up paying around ₹25,300/- for it.
The delivery experience with Amazon Prime was flawless and the product delivered within 36 hrs of placing the order.
Packing is good and reminds of Apple unboxing.
The first thing that comes to mind on using the product is its weight. Perhaps the lightest in its category. The head cushion is comfortable and even after using it for 2-3 hrs at a stretch one shouldn’t feel uncomfortable.
The battery charging is quick, from ~50% to full charge taking around 30 mins with a Type C fast charger.
Bluetooth connectivity is seamless with iPhone and the first-time pairing happens effortlessly.
However, while comparing with the Apple AirPod ProMax that am using since a year, the spatial sound experience is not as great. The additional volume control buttons in Apple is more convenient. Besides, with the Apple product, it switches seamlessly between all Apple devices based on what you’re attending to, something this doesn’t.
Overall, it’s a good product for single device usage, perhaps better than most others in its category, but definitely falls short of Apple.
Thought of adding this additional aspect after over a month of using the product. While using the headphone and listening to anything on your phone, every time a call comes, you’ll have to manually select your headphone for attending it, unlike on my Apple AirPod Max, where it automatically shifts to the call and back.

Product_Name: JLab JBuds LUX ANC Smart Active Noise Cancelling Headphones - Over Ear Wireless Headphones with Microphone, 70+ H Playtime Foldable Bluetooth Earphones with Multipoint & Customisable Sound, Graphite
Review_Title: Ottime ma con margine di miglioramento
Review_Text:
La mia prima impressione è stata che la plastica esterna sembrasse un po’ economica, ma sono rimasto sorpreso dalla leggerezza delle cuffie. Anche dopo lunghi periodi di utilizzo, quasi non si percepiscono addosso.

Il suono, come tipico di JLab, è caratterizzato da bassi pronunciati, ma qui sono accompagnati da una chiarezza notevole. A differenza di altri prodotti del marchio, dove il basso può risultare confuso, qui è ben definito e piacevole.

I padiglioni auricolari sono progettati in modo naturale e si adattano comodamente all'orecchio, ma il grip sulla testa non è eccezionale. Tendono a scivolare facilmente, rendendole poco adatte per l’uso in palestra o in movimento.

La batteria promette fino a 70 ore di autonomia e il cavo di ricarica USB-C incluso è di buona qualità, un aspetto positivo.

Un punto debole significativo è l’assenza di sensori capacitivi sui lati, che avrebbero potuto migliorare l’esperienza utente, magari con una funzione per attivare rapidamente la modalità "Be Aware" o Transparency. Questa mancanza è un’occasione persa per rendere il prodotto ancora più versatile.

In generale, cuffie leggere, confortevoli e con un suono ben bilanciato, ma con margini di miglioramento sul design e le funzionalità.

Product_Name: JLab JBuds LUX ANC Smart Active Noise Cancelling Headphones - Over Ear Wireless Headphones with Microphone, 70+ H Playtime Foldable Bluetooth Earphones with Multipoint & Customisable Sound, Graphite
Review_Title: Look no further: These beat Sony and Bose hands-down, and save you money
Review_Text: I love classical music, and love some good funk as well. I need ANC. I also sometimes have to fly, and cannot handle the incredible noise onboard airliners. I ordered JBL on-ear, and blessed a friend with them. Then ordered with Amazon Warehouse Deal the Bose QuietComfort 45, expecting Bose to be the audio connoisseur provider pur sang. Massive disappointment. Noticeable hiss of ANC and totally not HiFi sound. Switched to an Amazon Warehouse Deal Sony flagship WH-1000XM4. Painful headband, and again a hiss, and no HiFi sound. Almost gave up... And as for noise in airliners: None of these make it quiet. I end up wearing both earplugs and ANC in all of them. Choose to give JLAB a last change. Excellent price, excellent wearing comfort, wonderful HiFi sound experience, and no hiss. Slightly weaker in ANC performance, but still wholly adequate. And without a warehouse deal, still under 100 Canadian. JBAL beat the giants by a long stretch. Warmly recommended.

Product_Name: ZEBRONICS Zeb-Bro in Ear Wired Earphones with Mic, 3.5mm Audio Jack, 10mm Drivers, Phone/Tablet Compatible(Blue) (Black)
Review_Title: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Amazing Earphones – Great Sound and Unbeatable Value
Review_Text:
The ZEBRONICS Zeb-Bro in-ear wired earphones are a fantastic find! 🎧 For such an affordable price, the sound quality is truly impressive. The 10mm drivers deliver clear audio with balanced bass, making music, podcasts, and calls a pleasure. Whether I’m listening to soft melodies or bass-heavy tracks, the sound is crisp and immersive. 🎵

The in-built mic is a great addition, ensuring clear communication during calls without any issues. I’ve used these earphones for both meetings and casual conversations, and the performance is flawless.

The 3.5mm audio jack offers wide compatibility, and it works perfectly with my phone, laptop, and tablet. Plus, the comfort of the earbuds is worth mentioning – they fit snugly without causing any discomfort, even during extended use.

What I love the most is how lightweight and durable these earphones are. The cable is of decent length and doesn't tangle easily, which is a huge bonus. For such a budget-friendly price, ZEBRONICS has nailed it with both quality and performance!

If you’re looking for reliable, everyday earphones that offer great sound at an affordable price, the Zeb-Bro is an excellent choice.

Five stars – Highly recommended! 🌟

The only negative side I will point out is about the quality of the product. The wire quality is not upto the mark (3/5), you have to handle it carefully and the earbuds are made of plastic material.
Also the the button in the microphone is not at all useful, sometimes it works only to stop ongoing songs but you can't increase or decrease the volume.

Overall I'll give it 4✨under the price I bought.

An important suggestion:-
If you find this product under the range of ₹200.And dont want to go for some high rate earhones, just go for it. It would be a good product to you. Otherwise, you can check out for some other earphones under 500.
Some of them are boat or MI earphones and boult audio bass earphones. 👍

Hope this will be helpful for you guys.🙂

Product_Name: ZEBRONICS Zeb-Bro in Ear Wired Earphones with Mic, 3.5mm Audio Jack, 10mm Drivers, Phone/Tablet Compatible(Blue) (Black)
Review_Title: ZEBRONICS Zeb-Bro Wired Earphones: Decent Sound but Lacks Durability
Review_Text:
I recently purchased the ZEBRONICS Zeb-Bro Wired Earphones, and while they offer decent sound quality and a comfortable fit, there are some concerns regarding their durability.

Let's start with the positives. The earphones provide a snug fit, ensuring comfort even during long listening sessions. The 10mm drivers deliver satisfactory sound performance, allowing you to enjoy your favorite music and audio with clarity. The passive noise cancellation feature is an added bonus, as it helps immerse you in your audio experience by reducing external noise distractions.

Connecting the earphones to your device is a straightforward process. Simply plug in the 3.5mm audio jack, and within a few seconds, the earphones sync with your phone or tablet, ready to deliver audio.

On the downside, the build quality of the earphone cable raises concerns. Some users have reported that the wires are not as sturdy as expected, making them susceptible to damage and tangling. This weakness in the wire construction may impact the longevity of the earphones, requiring extra care and attention during use and storage.

The ZEBRONICS Zeb-Bro Wired Earphones come in a sleek design and are available in multiple color options, including Black, Blue, Green, Red, and White, allowing you to choose the one that suits your style.

In terms of technical specifications, the earphones have an impedance of 16 Ω and a frequency response range of 20Hz-20kHz. The 1.2-meter cable length provides adequate flexibility for comfortable usage.

It's important to note that these earphones come with a 6-month warranty, which provides some assurance in case of any manufacturing defects or malfunctions within the specified period.

In conclusion, the ZEBRONICS Zeb-Bro Wired Earphones offer decent sound quality and a comfortable fit, making them suitable for everyday use. However, the durability concerns surrounding the wire strength are worth considering. If you prioritize longevity and robustness in your earphone choice, you may want to explore other options. Nevertheless, if you handle them with care, these earphones can provide an enjoyable audio experience at an affordable price point.

Product_Name: JLab JBuds LUX ANC Smart Active Noise Cancelling Headphones - Over Ear Wireless Headphones with Microphone, 70+ H Playtime Foldable Bluetooth Earphones with Multipoint & Customisable Sound, Sage
Review_Title: Ottime ma con margine di miglioramento
Review_Text: La mia prima impressione è stata che la plastica esterna sembrasse un po’ economica, ma sono rimasto sorpreso dalla leggerezza delle cuffie. Anche dopo lunghi periodi di utilizzo, quasi non si percepiscono addosso.Il suono, come tipico di JLab, è caratterizzato da bassi pronunciati, ma qui sono accompagnati da una chiarezza notevole. A differenza di altri prodotti del marchio, dove il basso può risultare confuso, qui è ben definito e piacevole.I padiglioni auricolari sono progettati in modo naturale e si adattano comodamente all'orecchio, ma il grip sulla testa non è eccezionale. Tendono a scivolare facilmente, rendendole poco adatte per l’uso in palestra o in movimento.La batteria promette fino a 70 ore di autonomia e il cavo di ricarica USB-C incluso è di buona qualità, un aspetto positivo.Un punto debole significativo è l’assenza di sensori capacitivi sui lati, che avrebbero potuto migliorare l’esperienza utente, magari con una funzione per attivare rapidamente la modalità "Be Aware" o Transparency. Questa mancanza è un’occasione persa per rendere il prodotto ancora più versatile.In generale, cuffie leggere, confortevoli e con un suono ben bilanciato, ma con margini di miglioramento sul design e le funzionalità.

Product_Name: JLab JBuds LUX ANC Smart Active Noise Cancelling Headphones - Over Ear Wireless Headphones with Microphone, 70+ H Playtime Foldable Bluetooth Earphones with Multipoint & Customisable Sound, Sage
Review_Title: Look no further: These beat Sony and Bose hands-down, and save you money
Review_Text: I love classical music, and love some good funk as well. I need ANC. I also sometimes have to fly, and cannot handle the incredible noise onboard airliners. I ordered JBL on-ear, and blessed a friend with them. Then ordered with Amazon Warehouse Deal the Bose QuietComfort 45, expecting Bose to be the audio connoisseur provider pur sang. Massive disappointment. Noticeable hiss of ANC and totally not HiFi sound. Switched to an Amazon Warehouse Deal Sony flagship WH-1000XM4. Painful headband, and again a hiss, and no HiFi sound. Almost gave up... And as for noise in airliners: None of these make it quiet. I end up wearing both earplugs and ANC in all of them. Choose to give JLAB a last change. Excellent price, excellent wearing comfort, wonderful HiFi sound experience, and no hiss. Slightly weaker in ANC performance, but still wholly adequate. And without a warehouse deal, still under 100 Canadian. JBAL beat the giants by a long stretch. Warmly recommended.

On a scale Bad, Ok, fine , Good, Excellent

 If Looking for concert Rocking Loud Audio Over the Head Headset - DON'T BUY.. will Not get loudness .

Design Good - Weight Bad

Ear Protection Good - Audio Quality Good

Product_Name: JBL Tune 760NC, Wireless Over Ear Active Noise Cancellation Headphones with Mic, Upto 50 Hours Playtime, Multi-Device Connectivity, Pure Bass, AUX & Voice Assistant Support for Mobile Phones (Blue)
Review_Title: Sound quality is good on wired mode but really bad on wireless mode.
Review_Text: Just after unboxing, I tested the headphone. On wireless mode, I didn't find the sound quality to be as great as I expected it to be. The noice cancellation was also not exceptional. The main problem was that when I plugged in the audio cable, I found out that the right earcup of the headphone was not working at all. It was because of loose-connection (inside headphones) somewhere I guess. I decided to give it some time before I tested it once again. This time, the wireless mode sound quality dropped significantly (On sharp beats, it started producing cracking sounds). This time on wired mode, both the earcups worked fine and the sound quality was really good. After 2-3 days of usage, cracking sound is still there on wireless mode. Overall I am not satisfied with these headphones. I would recommend not investing such an amount in JBL headphones but rather to go for budget earphones. I don't think JBL puts their best efforts in this price range. If you really want high quality, go for a high-price flagship model.

Product_Name: JBL Tune 760NC, Wireless Over Ear Active Noise Cancellation Headphones with Mic, Upto 50 Hours Playtime, Multi-Device Connectivity, Pure Bass, AUX & Voice Assistant Support for Mobile Phones (Blue)
Review_Text: Noise cancellation feature is awesome, The music is not loud, but soothing good for movie watching

Product_Name: JBL Tune 760NC, Wireless Over Ear Active Noise Cancellation Headphones with Mic, Upto 50 Hours Playtime, Multi-Device Connectivity, Pure Bass, AUX & Voice Assistant Support for Mobile Phones (Blue)
Review_Text:
I've used a lot of brands and types of headphones, so I don't think there's any wow factor for this headphone, even at price 4.4k₹.
My experience:
I am using over ear headphones after a long time, so I can say this is a little different. I wish the earcups were a little bigger. Bigger and proper insulated earpads already make the headphones somewhat noice resistance.  I have small ears, so it covers 80-90 only. For long use, my ears feel sweaty and a little bit cramped ( same as wearing winter cap over ear for long time ).
Sound :
For sound I can say, ANC is not that wonderful ( I am experiencing for first time). If u use it in room with cooler/fan, it just feels like you came 10ft away after ANC, nothing magical. Good padding can achieve that easily.
The sound quality is good, no distortion or oberbass, as a musician I can say it's somewhat balanced. The volume is little bit less, but not to be an issue.
In call I didn't recieve any complaint from the other side.
Other:
Changing device is fast. My boat 255 pro+, 330 pro+ takes some time to switch. It works fine. If i connect aux, BT turns off.
Battery is good, tried for 4-5 hours and 10% battery dropped.
Cons:
I wish the earcups were little bigger.
The mobility of earcups could be better, so that I could pack it for travel.
Verdict: I think as a overear headphones from reputed brand, only under 5k, this is best choice.

Product_Name: JBL Tune 760NC, Wireless Over Ear Active Noise Cancellation Headphones with Mic, Upto 50 Hours Playtime, Multi-Device Connectivity, Pure Bass, AUX & Voice Assistant Support for Mobile Phones (Blue)

Overall, its the best in class with all the essential features embedded in it...A must try headphones by everyone...I'm really enjoyng each and every song played over these headphones...Loving it...😍

Product_Name: JBL Tune 760NC, Wireless Over Ear Active Noise Cancellation Headphones with Mic, Upto 50 Hours Playtime, Multi-Device Connectivity, Pure Bass, AUX & Voice Assistant Support for Mobile Phones (Blue)
Review_Title: Great headphone, but lacking app support
Review_Text:
I have been using the headphones (TUNE 760) for more than a month, here is my review

At first (2 days of purchasing) I was very disappointed because I felt that the sound quality was very lacking, the base and loudness disappointed me, but after a week, it started to sound very very good, I think it needed a burn period, because this headphone is now sounding very very good for me.

Build Quality - the build quality is good, no major issues, the pad is soft.

Comfort - the headphone is comfortable, but one issue is that the clamping force is a bit tight, maybe because I have a big head. Another thing is, even though this is an over read headphone it is not that big, so some part of my ear gets a bit uncomfortable after long use, but if u adjust and find the correct comfortable position, you cab wear it for a long time, I watched a 3 hr movie without any issues

Battery - omg, one of the best part of this headphone, claims 50 hr without noise cancellation, I think it lives upto the mark. You don't have to worry about battery

Sound quality - I'm not an audiophile, let me clear it up. The sound quality I felt was really good and I was very impressed, after the burn in period, so if you are buying this give it at least 1 week before judging it, trust me it really really gets better. The base was not that high, but not lacking also, was upto the mark.

Noise cancellation - it wasn't really that great, could slightly reduce the fan noise that's it, I wouldn't say it is useless, but not that bad either, could reduce the noise of tv from next room when I listened to music, so it did came in handy also with noise cancellation the sound quality I felt improved a bit.

Conclusion - as I said, I was really disappointed at first with the purchase, thought I wasted the money(6.5k) but now I'm really really enjoyed it, watching movies was the best experience with dolby music profile in my phone. I'd say it is really worth the money if ur looking for a headphone around 7k

Product_Name: JBL Tune 760NC, Wireless Over Ear Active Noise Cancellation Headphones with Mic, Upto 50 Hours Playtime, Multi-Device Connectivity, Pure Bass, AUX & Voice Assistant Support for Mobile Phones (Blue)
Review_Text:
Sound Quality: 5/5

In my experience, the JBL Tune 760NC headphones have delivered an exceptional audio experience. The sound is crystal clear with a well-balanced mix of highs, mids, and lows. The bass is robust and full-bodied, enhancing my enjoyment of a wide range of music genres.

Noise Cancellation: 4.5/5

The active noise cancellation feature of these headphones is a definite highlight. It effectively filters out ambient noise, providing an uninterrupted listening experience. However, I have noticed that it can struggle slightly with very high-frequency sounds, hence the less than perfect score.

Comfort: 4/5

The JBL Tune 760NC headphones offer a comfortable fit, thanks to a well-padded headband and soft ear cushions, making them ideal for extended listening sessions. However, as someone with a larger head, I've found the fit to be somewhat tight, which can lead to some discomfort over longer periods of use.

Volume Control: 3/5

While these headphones offer top-tier sound quality, I've had some issues with the volume control. When I adjust the volume on my device, the audio output on the headphones drops significantly. This has occasionally disrupted my listening experience, especially when I need to frequently adjust the volume.

Battery Life: 5/5

One area where the JBL Tune 760NC headphones truly excel is battery life. With up to 40 hours of playtime when the ANC is activated, these headphones have reliably lasted several days of average use without needing a recharge. This feature has made them a reliable choice for me, particularly during travel.

Design and Build: 4.5/5

I appreciate the sleek, foldable design and sturdy build of these headphones, which reflect JBL's commitment to quality. However, I've found that the control buttons, particularly for volume adjustment, could be more user-friendly.

Value for Money: 4/5

Despite the issue with volume control, I believe that the JBL Tune 760NC headphones offer good value for their price point. The superior sound quality, reliable noise cancellation, and impressive battery life make these headphones a worthwhile investment, even if they're slightly more expensive than some other models on the market.

Overall Rating: 4.3/5

In conclusion, despite a minor setback with volume control, my experience with the JBL Tune 760NC Wireless Over-Ear Active Noise-Cancelling Headphones has been largely positive. They deliver a high-quality audio experience, making them a solid choice for music enthusiasts and professionals like myself.

Product_Name: JBL Tune 760NC, Wireless Over Ear Active Noise Cancellation Headphones with Mic, Upto 50 Hours Playtime, Multi-Device Connectivity, Pure Bass, AUX & Voice Assistant Support for Mobile Phones (Blue)
Review_Title: For a casual usage its the best option
Review_Text:
i have been using this ANC headphone for 3 months. there are many things i would like to share.

Lets break down the few factors

built quality - solid shape for both ears (normal ear size) portable and it folds so u can save space. and it wont fall from the shoulders or while putting in ears and do workouts, it stays in your head perfectly. not water resistant or proof however it is sweat proof and dust proof

Comfort- solid design for a normal ear size and cushions are soft but more than 4-5 hours without taking off use may leads to getting warm. it is basically weightless doesn't hurt head or ear its a nice design actually

ANC- its will not suppress complete surrounding sounds but ye does the job this price range, above 80% volume will turn off the anc to deliver high volume sound

sound quality- never disappoints, its JBL. when u connect using bluetooth .headphone sets around 80% of volume people do complaint about low volume in headphone. u can increase in headphone using physical buttons, however the anc will automatically turn off. the bass is great

App support- doesn't give you JBL app support but in lower models such as JBL Live 670N, JBL 500 BT and higher model such as 770NC , JBL Tune 670NC JBL Tune 770NC only has them

Connections- dual connection is supported u can connect in your lap and mobile at the same time and listen from a device one at a time. and fast pairing in smartphones is so good and u can locate device on find my device too its a good feature

charging- fast charging is supported so for 5 minutes u will get playback time about 2 hours and total charging time takes about half an hour. while charging it heats and cool down
While charging u cant use Bluetooth and the design of the headset also not meant for that
u can use aux after the headset is dead

mic- good for calls and small use it isnt that good especially in windy places (example under the fan in a room) not good for professional use

CONCLUSION
its good for all rounder headphone in this price range.  Don't listen what others says even though there are some limitations but its prefect in many aspect. perfect for photographic materiel too. after a full charge i use it for 4 days roughly. if u have budget go for it

The aux cable is good too not too tight or too loose just perfect.Head adjustment mechanism is kinda funny because the headphones moves side to side faster when u take headphones out of adjustment idk why, could be less friction.While gaming with aux cable on u can get 0 latency(no sound delay) and can differentiate between lefts and rights and it's really helpful.I don't know the weight of headphones but they feels light on head so u can play games or watch movies without headacheCons: Build quality, full plastic body with only metal strip on head adjustment band and the plastic quality is ok ok...(cuz it broke ;-;).Charging port is loosely fitted so you have to sacrifice your cable life span.Cushion are comfy but the skin or we say covering starts to fall off after some time and the headphones looks like dog water.High latency in Bluetooth mode making it use aux cable while gaming only and if u dont have aux cable port in your device so just quit these headphones and look for something else.Looks too big on head so won't recommend for gym, walk usage.You came across whole review so here's ur cookie 🍪!

Product_Name: Audio-Technica ATH-M20x Over-Ear Professional Studio Monitor Headphones
Review_Text: Stumbled upon this page and couldn't move on without writing a review. It's been 5 years now and unmatched build, sound quality. The wire can be little uncomfortable at times but still worth it.

Product_Name: Audio-Technica ATH-M20x Over-Ear Professional Studio Monitor Headphones
Review_Text:
First of all, kudos to amazon for the excellent packaging and prompt delivery.
So, I come from that group of people who never spent more than 500 bucks for a pair of headphones. I've always used the pair that came along with  my phone. I also had a Sony mdr-zx110 for sometime. You can say that this is my first real pair of high quality headphones. Here are my thoughts.

Packaging:
The box is neatly packed with some paperwork, a connector to a DAC, and the headphones themselves. No surprises there.

Build and Comfort:
I was quite surprised by how light they felt at first use. The leather cups and top padding are an absolute delight and the adjusting mechanism works like a charm. It is a bit tight initially, but gets better with use. The cable is 3m long, which can be a good or a bad thing. Personally, would have liked it to be a bit shorter. Even after listening with them for 4 hours straight, there was neither any heat build up nor was it getting uncomfortable. But it made my ears sweat more than I was expecting it to. Overall, absolute delight to use even for longer periods.

Sound quality:
I plugged it into my Moto X and listened to some Coldplay and some Indian film music. I was expecting it to blow my mind, but realised my phone was doing justice to these pair. It sounds amazing though, better than anything I have tried. But had this feeling it had more to offer. AudioFX does offer a much better listening experience when turned on.
So, I plugged it into my laptop( a HP with B&O audio) and the tables turned completely. It was unlike anything I've experienced. The sounds coming out were so natural, and so very clear. Was able to catch every note of every instrument, was finding new sounds in the tracks that I didn't know even existed. There is adequate bass and the treble is excellent. The mids are where these really shine. The vocals and instrumentals are mind-blowing. Every genre I listened to was absolutely amazing. I think these are best suited for classical, instrumental, and Jazz. I listened to some hip-hop and found the bass a bit short but nevertheless, they did sound incredible. I tried some games like COD,Battlefield and FIFA, it enhances the experience quite a lot. In FIFA, the crowd comes alive and the gunshots in COD are brilliantly reproduced.

Verdict:
If you are a casual listener who is looking for their first pair of high quality headphones, look no further. Absolutely loving every moment of using this pair. It introduced me to a whole new dimension in music. Every other headphone I use now just doesn't feel right. In short, its the best 3000 bucks I ever spent.

Product_Name: Audio-Technica ATH-M20x Over-Ear Professional Studio Monitor Headphones
Review_Text: The best studio headphones for tracking and mixing audio under 5000rs,sounds are very crispy clear,low ends are decent,mids are upfront,highs are good enough,sound isolation is good ,the only thing is the ear pads are not the most comfortable can't use for more than 2 hours,and it's fully plastic.But the thing is all you're paying is the sound quality.

Review_Title: Best microphone under this price range
Review_Text: Sound quality is very good

Product_Name: Audio-Technica ATH-M20x Over-Ear Professional Studio Monitor Headphones
Review_Text:
The build quality of these headphones is outstanding. Audio-Technica is known for its durable construction, and this pair is no exception. The headphones are primarily made of high-quality plastic, reinforced with metal where it matters, making them lightweight yet sturdy. The ear cups and headband are well-padded with soft, comfortable materials, making long listening sessions a pleasure.

The design is sleek and professional—no flashy colors or unnecessary design elements, just a clean, minimalist look that suits both casual listeners and professionals.

Product_Name: Audio-Technica ATH-M20x Over-Ear Professional Studio Monitor Headphones
Review_Title: Absolute crisp top notch sound quality.. best companion for a listener!!
Review_Text:
5 ⭐ for sound quality 4⭐ because of the comfort.
Writing after 6 months of usage. This is an absolute best purchase you can have on a budget(I know what you think..though I said budget but I had to save up for three months to buy this for 4.5k INR. But compared to other studio monitor headphones and the sound quality youre getting for this price is just undeniable). I sincerely disagree with every single comments out there saying this doesn't have bass. If you're an avid listener and who listen to a lot of flac then you'll understand once you listen to this. So go for it.

 Even though they said it's flat sound but I could already feel decent amount of bass without changing any eq settings. If you want true flat sound I would say sennheiser is the choice. I have used sennheiser and Sony and this would come in the middle of both when it comes to bass but the sound quality is crisp af and top notch. And yes it does work great for movies too...I haven't played games much with this apart from one or two times.. and the wire is indeed quite long as mentioned in many other reviews...it can be a plus or minus depending on your purpose..for me it's okay as I sometimes use it with full length at home and I barely took it outside. But you can coil it up and use some velcro tape which I do sometimes..initially I felt it little bit tighter which is common for every headphones and as I have a big head but that was changed as I got used to it and it loosen up little bit and now fits perfectly without any discomfort which I experienced in the first two months.

 The only two drawbacks for me so far is that..one is the cushions tends to get your ears sweaty if you live in hot n humid place like mine. But inside an air conditioned room that wouldn't be much of an issue. Second thing is the small wire that goes between the headband and speakers on both side...that I felt like a poor design choice and gives me anxiety manytimes that if I'll break it somehow.

Product_Name: HAMMER Bash Max Over The Ear Wireless Bluetooth Headphones with Mic, Touch Control, Deep Bass, Upto 40 Hours Playtime, Bluetooth 5.3, Workout/Travel (Black)
Review_Text:
I’ve been using these headphones for a few weeks now, and I’m genuinely impressed. The comfort level is outstanding—even after hours of wearing them, there’s no discomfort or pressure on my ears. The ear cushions are soft, and the fit feels just right without being too tight.

The sound quality is phenomenal. The clarity is crisp, and the bass is deep but not overwhelming. Whether I’m listening to music, podcasts, or watching movies, everything sounds immersive and well-balanced. Noise isolation is also excellent, allowing me to focus without distractions.

If you’re looking for headphones that excel in both comfort and audio performance, these are a perfect choice. Highly recommended!

Product_Name: HAMMER Bash Max Over The Ear Wireless Bluetooth Headphones with Mic, Touch Control, Deep Bass, Upto 40 Hours Playtime, Bluetooth 5.3, Workout/Travel (Black)
Review_Title: Honest Review: Hammer Blash Max - Premium Performance at an Unbeatable Price.
Review_Text:
I've been using the Hammer Blash Max headphones for a month, and they’re honestly a hidden gem. The sound quality is absolutely incredible – rich, deep, and crystal clear. The mic performs great, making calls smooth, and the sound isolation helps me stay focused on my studies. As a student, it's a perfect choice, especially when compared to brands like Noise or BoAt in the same price range. The premium feel of these headphones really stands out.

What really sets the Blash Max apart is the design. The 180-degree rotation ensures they stay safe from damage when not in use, unlike other headsets that can break or tilt. The soft cushions and matte finish make long online classes and study sessions comfortable. Plus, they're ideal for outdoor activities, traveling, and gym workouts – they won’t fall off like buds, which is a huge bonus. Covering the full ear, they provide a much better experience than typical on-ear headphones.

The build quality is fantastic, and the customer support team is quick and responsive if you ever need assistance. The only slight drawback is the charging time, but once charged, the call quality is premium and clear, and the music is immersive. What really impressed me is the touch controls – something you rarely find in other brands at this price. If you're looking for a durable, stylish, and functional headset, the Hammer Blash Max is the way to go!

Product_Name: soundcore H30i Wireless On-Ear Headphones, Foldable Design, Pure Bass, 70H Playtime, Bluetooth 5.3, Lightweight and Comfortable, App Connectivity, Multipoint Connection
Review_Text: These are the best headphones that you can get under 3000. The build quality is very good, it is made of plastic but feels sturdy and very durable. They're light & don't feel heavy on my head, and they cover my ears well. There's some passive noise cancellation here which is better than nothing. I find the headphones comfortable and can listen to music on these for hours. The sound quality is very good for this price point. It's better than the likes of boat and others in this range easily. Music is a lot of fun to listen to and there's enough bass if you're a basshead. These headphones come with the soundcore app which boasts 22 equalisers. They all sound very distinct and can enhance your listening experience. Connectivity has been very good. Once these headphones are connected to my phone I've never had issues. The battery life is truly excellent. They last around 10 days on a 80% charge and I'm a heavy user. If you're a casual they should last you 2 weeks or more easily. There are buttons on the right side for power/Play-pause and volume which you can use in case your phone is out of reach. I've never tried gaming on these so I can't comment on the latency but overall these are excellent headphones if you want to use them for music and consuming media. I have been using them for the last month and so far they tick all the boxes. They are definitely on the pricier side but it's been a solid investment.

Product_Name: HAMMER Bash 2.0 Over The Ear Wireless Bluetooth Headphones with Mic, Deep Bass, Foldable Headphones, Upto 8 Hours Playtime, Workout/Travel, Bluetooth 5.0 (Grey)
Review_Text:
I’ve been using these headphones for a few weeks now, and I’m genuinely impressed. The comfort level is outstanding—even after hours of wearing them, there’s no discomfort or pressure on my ears. The ear cushions are soft, and the fit feels just right without being too tight.

The sound quality is phenomenal. The clarity is crisp, and the bass is deep but not overwhelming. Whether I’m listening to music, podcasts, or watching movies, everything sounds immersive and well-balanced. Noise isolation is also excellent, allowing me to focus without distractions.

If you’re looking for headphones that excel in both comfort and audio performance, these are a perfect choice. Highly recommended!

Product_Name: HAMMER Bash 2.0 Over The Ear Wireless Bluetooth Headphones with Mic, Deep Bass, Foldable Headphones, Upto 8 Hours Playtime, Workout/Travel, Bluetooth 5.0 (Grey)
Review_Title: Honest Review: Hammer Blash Max - Premium Performance at an Unbeatable Price.
Review_Text:
I've been using the Hammer Blash Max headphones for a month, and they’re honestly a hidden gem. The sound quality is absolutely incredible – rich, deep, and crystal clear. The mic performs great, making calls smooth, and the sound isolation helps me stay focused on my studies. As a student, it's a perfect choice, especially when compared to brands like Noise or BoAt in the same price range. The premium feel of these headphones really stands out.

What really sets the Blash Max apart is the design. The 180-degree rotation ensures they stay safe from damage when not in use, unlike other headsets that can break or tilt. The soft cushions and matte finish make long online classes and study sessions comfortable. Plus, they're ideal for outdoor activities, traveling, and gym workouts – they won’t fall off like buds, which is a huge bonus. Covering the full ear, they provide a much better experience than typical on-ear headphones.

The build quality is fantastic, and the customer support team is quick and responsive if you ever need assistance. The only slight drawback is the charging time, but once charged, the call quality is premium and clear, and the music is immersive. What really impressed me is the touch controls – something you rarely find in other brands at this price. If you're looking for a durable, stylish, and functional headset, the Hammer Blash Max is the way to go!

Product_Name: HAMMER Bash 2.0 Over The Ear Wireless Bluetooth Headphones with Mic, Deep Bass, Foldable Headphones, Upto 8 Hours Playtime, Workout/Travel, Bluetooth 5.0 (Grey)
Review_Title: Very tight and sound quality is average
Review_Text:
had high hopes for these headphones, but they turned out to be disappointing. While they look stylish, the fit is extremely tight on the ears, making them uncomfortable to wear. you cant wear it for more than 30 minutes,bclamping force is too much, and it causes discomfort rather quickly

for the sound quality, it’s average, if you’re looking for headphones that combine comfort with great sound, this is not the product for you.

Product_Name: HAMMER Bash 2.0 Over The Ear Wireless Bluetooth Headphones with Mic, Deep Bass, Foldable Headphones, Upto 8 Hours Playtime, Workout/Travel, Bluetooth 5.0 (Grey)
Review_Text:
In less than a year headphone earpad cushions are worn off. Having contacted call centre their reply is "in this type of issues are not repairable". Being a tropical weather country with relatively high humidty this wear & tear is normal for which maufacturer ought to have made provisions for cushion replacement at reasonable cost. It is understandable that this cannot be covered under warranty as it may be classified under consumables. Nevertheless manufacturer shouldn't deny repair at all. What's even more frustrating is that they don't have pan India service support. Only service centre is in Haryana.
I do not recommend anyone buy this. Reason for giving 4 star rating is for just the product and not for below average service support.
